title: Lakers face Luka Doncic-LeBron James crossroads after JJ Redick's latest on-court experiment
description: The Los Angeles Lakers are trying to ask Luka Doncic something that is completely not what he is used to.
fullText:
Lakers face Luka Doncic-LeBron James crossroads after JJ Redick's latest on-court experiment originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers pulled off one of the most groundbreaking trades just before the deadline last February. Acquiring Luka Donƒçiƒá was one of the most shocking deals in NBA history. While the Lakers want to build around him‚Äîand understand that it may take time‚ÄîDonƒçiƒá still wants to win now.

‚ÄúDonƒçiƒá being just 26 gives the Lakers a far longer timeline to build a championship-contending team, but that doesn't mean they can slow down and take their time. Donƒçiƒá told Lakers president Rob Pelinka and coach JJ Redick in May that he's not interested in taking the slow approach in building a contender,‚Äù CBS Sports‚Äô Jasmyn Wimbish wrote.

Los Angeles got off to a hot start, but lately the team has become stagnant. Defense has been a major reason for that struggle. As a result, head coach JJ Redick reportedly called a meeting with Donƒçiƒá and LeBron James, challenging them to step up on that end of the floor.

‚ÄúIt was good. We talked about a lot - not just that. But he was right. You got to get a little bit more, especially from the star players. So that‚Äôs on us, that‚Äôs on me.‚Äù - Luka Donƒçiƒá on JJ Redick‚Äôs recent meeting where he asked for more on the defensive end from him and LeBron,‚Äù Lakers insider Dave McMenamin posted.

It also appears that Redick is working to get Donƒçiƒá more involved off the ball.

‚ÄúJJ just inferred that he's been trying to get Luka to play more off-ball, but he's been reluctant and uncomfortable. However he made some progress in that regard today. If Luka learns how to play off-ball, even a 10% increase would make the Lakers so much more dangerous,‚Äù Lakers Daily posted.

While getting Donƒçiƒá involved off the ball could benefit the offense, it may also signal that Redick is still searching for the best way to keep all of his stars engaged. LeBron James has yet to have a truly dominant game, and that could be due in part to not having the ball in his hands as often.

Redick now appears to be at a crossroads as he works to maximize his roster. This is his current solution, but if Donƒçiƒá is unwilling to fully embrace the change, the offense could suffer. If these issues aren‚Äôt addressed soon, they could quickly become a significant problem.

title: Things to know if travelling to Molineux
description: Brentford take on Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux in our next Premier League fixture on Saturday 20 December (3pm kick-off GMT). The match will not be broadcast live in the UK.Here is everything y...
fullText:
Direct trains to Wolverhampton station depart London Euston hourly and take just under two hours.

Alternatively, trains run from Euston to Birmingham New Street, where you can get a frequent service to Wolverhampton which will take 16 minutes.

The last direct train home from Wolverhampton station to Euston leaves at 9.37pm and takes just under two and a half hours.

Molineux Stadium is around 15 minutes‚Äô walk from Wolverhampton station.

To take a bus from Wolverhampton train station to the ground, exit the station towards the city centre and follow signs to Wolverhampton Bus Station.

From here, use bus services 6 or 11 to within a short walk from the ground.

For those travelling from London, exit the M6 then exit at junction 10. From there, follow the A454 via Willenhall to Wolverhampton Ring Road. Once this is reached, take the fourth exit towards Stafford and follow signs for Molineux Stadium. The postcode for Molineux is WV1 4QR.

Off-site parking at University of Wolverhampton‚Äôs Science Park (WV10 9RU) can be booked on Wolves‚Äô ticketing site. This is approximately 30 minutes‚Äô walk from the stadium.

A range of council and privately run car parks are available in the city centre.

Tickets for this fixture will be distributed digitally. You will receive your ticket(s) by email ahead of the match. Please follow the instructions on the email to get your ticket ready on your phone.

For those that have requested a physical ticket or have sent a duplicate ticket request, the away ticket office which is located in the north-east corner of the stadium, opposite turnstile 11.

Any duplicate ticket requests must be sent to Wolves by the Brentford box office. The ticket office is located in the corner of the stadium, between the Stan Cullis stand and Billy Wright Stand. Please contact Brentford's box office with any enquiries ahead of matchday.

If you‚Äôre collecting your ticket at Molineux, please remember to bring ID.

Please also observe and respect the family friendly seating. Anyone who holds a ticket in this area is reminded that they should be seated for the duration of the match.

For away fans, Wolves provide audio description commentary, accessible toilets, and changing places facilities on request. For additional support on the day, speak to their team of dedicated accessibility stewards, recognised by their dark blue jackets with silver reflective stripes.

For any more information, please contact Wolves‚Äô disability access officer fanservices@wolves.co.uk.

Our hosts recommend the Prince Albert pub near to Wolverhampton station as a location for Brentford fans to meet before the game. The previously popular away pub The Blue Brick no longer accepts away fans. There are many other options for food and drink in Birmingham and Wolverhampton city centre.

Away supporters will be located in the Stan Cullis Quadrant lower and upper tier and can enter the stadium via turnstile block NF. Turnstiles open 90 minutes before kick-off.

Wolves host a mixed fan zone near block five of the stadium that welcomes away fans. Food and drink will be available and there is live entertainment.

It is advised that you don‚Äôt bring a bag to the match. Bags larger than A4 size will not be permitted inside the ground. There is no bag storage facility at Molineux.

Have a safe trip and enjoy the match!

title: Boy 'still on high' after Jack Grealish surprise
description: Georgie was nominated for the surprise after losing his father, grandmother and teaching assistant.
fullText:
An Everton fan whose close family members died from cancer received a surprise school visit from footballer Jack Grealish.

Eight-year-old Georgie's father and grandmother died after being diagnosed with cancer ‚Äì his mother has now been diagnosed with stage four blood cancer.

Georgie's mother Gemma nominated her son for the surprise on the last day of an Everton competition by his mother after the eight-year-old went through the loss of his father, grandmother and a teaching assistant.

Speaking of the visit to St Monica's Primary School in Bootle, Gemma said Grealish's visit had provided some relief after a "stressful" time.

His mother Gemma, who has been diagnosed with stage four blood cancer, said she "nearly cried on the phone" when the club called her to say Georgie had been selected.

"He's always loved Grealish, even when he was at Manchester City."

She told how she was asked to keep the visit to St Monica's Catholic Primary School in Bootle a secret and hide from her son when Grealish surprised Georgie's class earlier this month.

The club recently posted a video showing the children's delighted reactions, while the former Aston Villa player - who is on loan at the Blues from Manchester City - joined them in making Christmas crafts and joked that he and Georgie were "best mates".

"He was just so lovely, he just has a way about him with kids," Gemma said.

Gemma later met Grealish with her son and father Keith, who had also nominated Georgie for the surprise visit.

"Georgie asked [Grealish] to do an Erling Haaland celebration after he next scores for Everton."

The pupil has also been invited to be a mascot for Everton's match against Arsenal at the Hill Dickinson Stadium on Saturday.

Grealish said: "We'll look after him and I've heard he likes Declan Rice as well, so I'll make sure I get Dec's shirt for him."

Gemma, who found she had pneumonia after becoming ill during an Everton game, said Grealish's visit had provided some relief after a "stressful" time.

"It meant the world. Georgie's still on a high," she said.

Grandfather Keith said: "It means so much to us for Grealish to come and take the time to meet him and look after him.

"Georgie has coped with everything so well and been so supportive to his mum and everyone around him.

"He and his mum are an inspiration to me. The way they've handled it is phenomenal."

Listen to the best of BBC Radio Merseyside on Sounds and follow BBC Merseyside on Facebook, X, and Instagram. You can also send story ideas via Whatsapp to 0808 100 2230.

title: Arsenal battle to stay top of Christmas charts
description:
Could fast-charging Manchester City top the Premier League at Christmas or will Arsenal cling on to the festive number one spot?AFP Sport looks at three talking points ahead of the weekend action:
City eye top spot
Pep Guardiola's Manchester City have clicked ominously into gear and are just two points behind long-time Premier League leaders Arsenal.
fullText:
Could fast-charging Manchester City top the Premier League at Christmas or will Arsenal cling on to the festive number one spot?

Pep Guardiola's City host struggling West Ham at home on Saturday after six straight wins in all competitions, while the Gunners face a tricky trip to Everton later in the day.

Aston Villa take on Manchester United, looking to maintain an astonishing run that has catapulted them into the title race, while Liverpool travel to face stumbling Tottenham.

Pep Guardiola's Manchester City have clicked ominously into gear and are just two points behind long-time Premier League leaders Arsenal.

The Gunners have a tough run of league fixtures coming up, starting away at Everton, with Brighton, Aston Villa, Bournemouth and Liverpool to follow.

City, hungry to reclaim the title they lost to Liverpool last year, will go top of the table, at least temporarily, if they beat the Hammers.

Mikel Arteta's team looked jaded in their 2-1 win against bottom side Wolverhampton last week and were lucky to escape with three points after an own goal deep into stoppage time.

They managed just two shots on target despite their rich attacking resources.

Arteta also lamented "horrible defensive habits that are nowhere near the levels required" against Wolves but that must be put in the context of a spate of serious injuries.

William Saliba was back for the trip to Molineux but Gabriel Magalhaes and Cristhian Mosquera are on the treatment table while the Gunners lost Ben White with a hamstring injury during the match.

Arsenal remain favourites to win their first Premier League title since 2004 but cannot afford to let City take charge.

Arsenal and Manchester City remain the clear favourites to win the Premier League but it is difficult to rule out Aston Villa.

Unai Emery's side, who did not even manage a goal in their first four games this season, have won 10 of their past 11 league matches and are just three points behind Arsenal.

But it is not just the wins -- it is the manner of the victories.

Villa twice came from behind to beat West Ham 3-2 last week after recovering from two goals down to beat Brighton and scoring a last-gasp winner against Arsenal.

Emery says his players are not feeling under pressure.

"We are feeling ambitious and we try to challenge in Europe and in the Premier League," said the Spaniard. "Enjoy each match, try to prepare, then rest.

"The players must feel comfortable doing it. This is the process we are doing. Now it is Manchester United."

Emery conjured a victory against United at Villa Park in his first match in charge but that remains the only time Villa have beaten the Red Devils at home in the Premier League since 1995.

Thomas Frank admitted there was no "quick fix" at Tottenham after their painful 3-0 defeat at Nottingham Forest last week.

But how patient will the Spurs hierarchy be after just four wins in their past 14 games in all competitions.

Fans endured a terrible Premier League campaign under Ange Postecoglou last season, when the club finished 17th, but at least they were entertained and ultimately celebrated Europa League glory.

There has been little tangible progress under former Brentford boss Frank, whose 11th-placed team are hosting champions Liverpool.

After 16 league games in 2024/25, Postecoglou's team had scored 11 more goals and conceded two fewer than Frank's side.

Strikingly, only Everton, Sunderland and Wolves have had fewer shots on target than Tottenham, even though they reinforced their attack in the summer transfer window, bringing in Mohammed Kudus, Xavi Simons and Randal Kolo Muani.

Frank is confident he will get the time to turn things around but the clock is ticking.

Saturday (1500 GMT unless stated)

Newcastle v Chelsea (1230), Bournemouth v Burnley, Brighton v Sunderland, Manchester City v West Ham, Wolves v Brentford, Tottenham v Liverpool (1730), Everton v Arsenal, Leeds v Crystal Palace (both 2000)

Aston Villa v Manchester United

title: Gary Neville makes prediction ahead of Liverpool‚Äôs clash with Spurs
description: Neville voices doubt as Liverpool face defining Tottenham testLiverpool head to Tottenham this weekend carrying momentum, but also a growing sense of uncertainty that has caught the attention of one o...
fullText:
Liverpool head to Tottenham this weekend carrying momentum, but also a growing sense of uncertainty that has caught the attention of one of the game‚Äôs most prominent voices. Speaking ahead of the trip to north London, Neville openly questioned whether Liverpool currently possess the authority and consistency required to win one of the Premier League‚Äôs most demanding away fixtures.

The Reds arrive in good form on paper, unbeaten in their last four league matches and fresh from a controlled victory over Brighton. Yet this fixture, against a Tottenham side unpredictable but dangerous at home, has divided opinion among pundits and supporters alike. Neville‚Äôs remarks crystallise a broader debate about where Liverpool truly stand at this stage of the season.

Neville‚Äôs assessment was notable for its honesty rather than its certainty. He admitted difficulty in calling the outcome, initially leaning towards a draw before posing the central question: can Liverpool go there and win?

That hesitation speaks volumes. Tottenham‚Äôs home form has been erratic, but the fixture has historically been uncomfortable for visiting sides. For Liverpool, this match represents more than just three points. It is a barometer of progress under Arne Slot, whose side has prioritised control and structure over relentless dominance.

Neville eventually shifted his stance towards a narrow Liverpool victory, though the lack of conviction remained clear. His uncertainty echoed the wider panel discussion, with predictions ranging from high-scoring draws to a tight away win. Such variation underlines how finely balanced this contest appears.

Liverpool‚Äôs recent performances have been solid rather than spectacular. The win over Brighton was efficient, marked by defensive discipline and a composed display in possession. However, questions persist about whether that level translates seamlessly against elite opposition away from home.

Under Slot, Liverpool are showing signs of stability, but not yet the ruthless edge that once defined their peak years. The side is conceding fewer clear chances and managing games more effectively, yet moments of hesitation and missed opportunities have prevented them from pulling away from rivals in decisive fashion.

This is where Neville‚Äôs scepticism finds its footing. Tottenham, for all their flaws, remain capable of exploiting lapses, particularly in transition. Liverpool‚Äôs ability to maintain focus for the full ninety minutes will be critical.

Tottenham‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses make them a unique opponent. Their aggressive approach can leave space, but it also places immense physical and mental demands on visiting teams. For Liverpool, coping with that intensity while imposing their own game plan is the real test.

Jamie Carragher pointed to Tottenham‚Äôs struggles on home soil as a reason for optimism, while others predicted a goal-heavy draw. What is clear is that Liverpool will need more than control; they will need conviction.

A positive result would reinforce the sense that Liverpool are edging towards something more substantial under Slot. A draw or defeat, however, would keep doubts alive and lend weight to Neville‚Äôs question.

Matches like this often define seasons. Liverpool have the chance to send a message, not only to Tottenham but to the wider league, that their upward trajectory is real. Winning away against a direct rival would provide tangible proof of growth.

Neville‚Äôs comments should be viewed less as criticism and more as a challenge. Liverpool have the tools, the form and the platform. What remains to be seen is whether they have the authority to impose themselves when the spotlight is brightest.

Sunday‚Äôs clash will not decide the title race, but it may shape perceptions. For Liverpool, that alone makes the trip to Tottenham unmissable.

title: Real Madrid set to hand an improved contract to teenage gem following first-team debut
description: V√≠ctor Valdepenas is currently living a dream at Real Madrid. An academy player, who is a part of the Castilla setup currently, the teenage defender made his debut with the first team last Sunday at ...
fullText:
V√≠ctor Valdepenas is currently living a dream at Real Madrid. An academy player, who is a part of the Castilla setup currently, the teenage defender made his debut with the first team last Sunday at Mendizorroza against Alaves.

The 19-year-old talent started as the left-back for Real Madrid last weekend due to the absences of Alvaro Carreras and Fran Garcia through suspension, while Ferland Mendy was unavailable through injury.

With Carreras and Garcia ruled out against Sevilla as well and Mendy unlikely to return, Valdepenas could once again start for Real Madrid on Saturday night.

Now, according to Mundo Deportivo, Real Madrid will improve the contract of Valdepenas by increasing his salary due to his good performances.

This was already planned even before his official first-team debut last Sunday at Mendizorroza. The length of his contract will not be changed and continues to run until 2029.

Valdepenas made his debut vs Alaves. (Photo by Juan Manuel Serrano Arce/Getty Images)

Valdepenas is considered one of the biggest prospects currently coming through the Real Madrid academy.

The versatile defender has played in 13 of the 16 league matches this season for Castilla, scoring and assisting one goal apiece. In addition, he has scored a goal from two UEFA Youth League matches and even featured once in the U21 Premier League International Cup.

Apart from having made his first-team debut, Valdepenas has also been included in the squad for the Champions League game vs Manchester City and the Copa del Rey clash against Talavera.

Given his talent and potential, Real Madrid will improve the versatile defender‚Äôs salary as a reward for his strong performances with Castilla.

Last summer, clubs such as Borussia Dortmund, Bayer Leverkusen and Arsenal made enquiries about Valdepenas and remain interested. It could be a factor behind Real Madrid offering him an improved deal.

title: ‚ÄòThey spew lies‚Äô ‚Äì Barcelona president Joan Laporta hits back at Real Madrid and Florentino Perez
description: Some very strong words.
fullText:
Barcelona president Joan Laporta has hit back at Real Madrid and Florentino Perez with some harsh words in a pre-Christmas speech.

Perez went on the attack earlier this week, calling the Negreira Case the ‚Äòbiggest scandal in football,‚Äô and also criticising La Liga referees once again.

Laporta how now responded with strong very strong words and made his disdain for Los Blancos crystal clear.

‚ÄúThey are the ones who confuse power with despotism. They are the ones who practice cynicism and disproportionate arrogance. They are the ones who have a disgraceful television program that only spews lies and constantly and permanently poisons the atmosphere. To them I say that Bar√ßa is strong again, both on and off the pitch,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThe size we have generates an envy that is poorly handled by these people who, with underhanded tactics, disregard all codes of conduct, ethical and moral, and not just sporting ones, I mean in general.

‚ÄúI imagine you know who I am referring to, those who are the architects of permanent campaigns to discredit our badge and our essence, and we will not allow this.‚Äù

Laporta also said that Madrid‚Äôs regular attacks will not harm Barcelona as he looked forward to a bright future for the club.

‚ÄúTogether we know that in every sporting, social, institutional and even economic action we leave our mark, as a respected, recognized, admired and beloved club,‚Äù he added.

‚ÄúWhile they destroy and try to erase or distort history, they will not succeed. We are building, and we are building a glorious new chapter in Bar√ßa‚Äôs history that will once again reach glory and make history, and this is thanks to you, fundamentally.‚Äù

title: Supercoppa: Bologna vs. Inter ‚Äì probable line-ups and where to watch on TV
description: Santiago Castro will lead the Bologna attack in the Supercoppa Italiana semifinal against Inter, but Ange-Yoan Bonny could replace Lautaro Martinez for the Nerazzurri.It kicks off at 20:00 CET (19:00 ...
fullText:
Santiago Castro will lead the Bologna attack in the Supercoppa Italiana semifinal against Inter, but Ange-Yoan Bonny could replace Lautaro Martinez for the Nerazzurri.

It kicks off at 20:00 CET (19:00 GMT) at the King Saud University Stadium in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

BOLOGNA, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 04: Santiago Castro of Bologna celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs second goal during the Coppa Italia Round of 16 match between Bologna FC and Parma Calcio at Renato Dall‚ÄôAra Stadium on December 04, 2025 in Bologna, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

The winner will face Napoli in the Final on Monday, December 22, as the Partenopei beat Milan 2-0 on Thursday.

Lukasz Skorupski, Remo Freuler and Nicol√≤ Casale are unavailable for Bologna, while Inter must cope without Francesco Acerbi, Matteo Darmian, Denzel Dumfries, Raffaele Di Gennaro and Tomas Palacios.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 03: Ange-Yoan Bonny of FC Internazionale Milano celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs fifth goal during the Coppa Italia round of 16 match between FC Internazionale and Venezia FC at San Siro Stadium on December 03, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Sky Sport and Gazzetta report that Castro will start as a centre-forward for the Rossoblu, while Federico Bernardeschi is favourite over Riccardo Orsolini in the right winger position.

Inter will likely pick Stefan de Vrij, Alessandro Bastoni and Yann Bisseck, while Josep Martinez will start in goal.

According to Gazzetta, Davide Frattesi will start in place of Nicol√≤ Barella in central midfield, while Bonny is favourite over Lautaro Martinez up front.

The match will be televised on Premier Sports 2 in the UK and Ireland and on Paramount+ in the USA. Football Italia will provide a live commentary through a liveblog.

Bologna (4-2-3-1): ¬†Ravaglia; Holm, Heggem, Lucum√≠, Miranda; Moro, Pobega; Bernardeschi, Odgaard, Cambiaghi; Castro.

Inter (3-5-2): Martinez J.; Bisseck, De Vrij, Bastoni; Luis Henrique, Frattesi, Zielinski, Mkhitaryan, Dimarco; Bonny, Thuram.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Marcus Thuram looks ahead to 'passionate' Supercoppa semi-final
description: Inter forward Marcus Thuram has revealed his delight at playing in Saudi Arabia ahead the Supercoppa Italiana semi-final with Bologna on Friday.The Nerazzurri take on Bologna in Riyadh later this even...
fullText:
Inter forward Marcus Thuram has revealed his delight at playing in Saudi Arabia ahead the Supercoppa Italiana semi-final with Bologna on Friday.

The Nerazzurri take on Bologna in Riyadh later this evening with the winner playing Napoli in Monday's final.

And Thuram has admitted he's excited to play outside of Italy in front of a fervent crowd at¬†Al-Awwal Park.

"It's always great to play outside of Italy, we played this summer in America and it was great," he told OneFootball.

"We saw a lot of fans here too, so it's always great to travel around the world and see that we have so many supporters.

"They [Saudi fans last year] left me the same impression that all fans around the world have, that they're very passionate about our game and it's lovely to see."

Thuram is expected to start alongside Lautaro Martinez and will be hoping to add to his tally of eight goals in 18 appearances so far this term.

üì∏ MARCO BERTORELLO - AFP or licensors

title: Rumour Mongering: Guehi, Semenyo, Elliot, Contract Renewals and More
description: Lewis Steele provided insight into a wide array of subjects in a Q&A.
fullText:
The Daily Mail‚Äôs Lewis Steele conducted a wide-ranging Q&A on Liverpool FC, covering transfers, contract renewals, and more. Let‚Äôs comb through the highlights.

On a potential Antoine Semenyo transfer, he had this to say:

‚ÄúSemenyo was certainly one that was talked about at Anfield at the start of the summer window. Now the only problem is there‚Äôs so many teams that are in for him.‚Äù

‚ÄúCan‚Äôt read it too much, but he gave tickets to his old friends for old Trafford game on Monday.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut I think if Liverpool really wanted to do this sign and they could. And I think that with all due respect to Tottenham and Man United, I think if you‚Äôve got them free in front of you, you choose Liverpool.‚Äù

For Marc Guehi, and if the transfer will happen, and if it‚Äôll happen in January or the summer:

‚ÄúI still think Liverpool have a really good chance of signing Guehi. The only question is, is that in January for a fee or is that in the summer for nothing?‚Äù

‚ÄúI think Guehi himself would rather it be in the summer. He‚Äôs playing in Europe for the 1st time with Crystal Palace, I think he feels a bit of a loyalty to not leave midseason and also if he leaves on a free, then he gets good money in terms of the wages.‚Äù

‚ÄúLiverpool aren‚Äôt the only team in for him, we know Bayern Munich is sniffing around. Manchester City, Real Madrid would like to have a go as well.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut I just wonder whether there‚Äôs a sort of under the table, gentlemen‚Äôs agreement between Liverpool and Guehi, from September the 1st or whatever date it was, because they were literally that close to him signing.‚Äù

‚ÄúI think Liverpool have every chance. The word from the club may be caution over a January transfer, but on August the 30th, the word from the club was not going to sign Alexander Isak and look what happened there.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo I think Liverpool have every chance of getting him in January. If not, the summer.‚Äù

Steele was also asked about the murmurs that have been circulating about Crystal Palace‚Äôs Adam Wharton:

‚ÄúNothing imminent. I can‚Äôt see Liverpool signing a midfielder in January. But I think Adam Wharton certainly has his admirers at Anfield, and he could be one to watch for the summer.‚Äù

Harvey Elliott‚Äôs bizarre loan to Aston Villa, where he hasn‚Äôt played since October, was also addressed:

‚ÄúThe clubs could shake hands in January on terminating the loan agreement, it doesn‚Äôt really benefit anyone.‚Äù

When asked if Arne Slot was frustrated by the failure of recruitment to get any transfer deal over the line, Steele said:

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any frustration from Slot. It‚Äôs easy to say in hindsight, but I think Slot was perfectly happy with the window. ‚Äú

On contract renewals, Ibrahima Konat√©‚Äôs situation doesn‚Äôt seem to have changed much, even with Real Madrid pulling out of the race to sign him:

‚ÄúKonate and Liverpool have been in talks over a new deal for nearly 18 months. So far, they have been very far apart.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt really ever heard from Konate whether he actually is all in on wanting to stay at Liverpool. Although interest from Madrid has become weaken, PSG would always appeal to him for his nationality, I‚Äôm sure that they would maybe consider it if they got some encouragement, but as of yet, it does seem more likely than not that he would be at Liverpool.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think that Liverpool would be removing any contract offering.‚Äù

Also on contract renewals, early talks have begun for key midfielders Dominik Szoboszlai, Ryan Gravenberch and Alexis Mac Allister:

‚ÄúThere are talks underway, very preliminary talk, but I think Liverpool are keen to extend all 3 of those deals.‚Äù

Last but not least, Steele answered some questions about the status of some squad members, including injured players, and the ones on the periphery of the squad. For Jeremie Frimpong, who is nearing a return:

‚ÄúVery, very soon. Maybe not quite ready to play at the weekend, but I think he‚Äôll be back in full training in the next couple of days, certainly in the next week, he‚Äôs been back in the grass for a while now doing some 1v1 gym stuff as well.‚Äù

Steele had a very interesting answer concerning Federico Chiesa, and his inability to get any starts:

‚ÄúSlot, wouldn‚Äôt mind me saying it, just doesn‚Äôt seem like he trusts him(Chiesa). That‚Äôs just a guess that I got because I know when they lost at Plymouth, Slot was furious with Chiesa. He was one of the senior players on that day and he just didn‚Äôt seem to (perform), a few people have said how frustrated Slot was.‚Äù

‚ÄúI just think what Chiesa has to do is,to prove to Arne Slot that he deserves a chance because if you lose in every game, you can‚Äôt get a game. Then you sort of think that maybe he doesn‚Äôt like him at all.‚Äú

It seems to me like Chiesa could come off the bench and score every week. He still wouldn‚Äôt play.‚Äù

The Plymouth game stuck out in my mind for a while after it happened, but he‚Äôs had so many key moments after that so it‚Äôs bizarre. But I‚Äôm also not a professional football coach so‚Ä¶

On the status of Stefan Bajcetic and Jayden Danns, who are working their way back from surgeries:

‚ÄúStefan Bajcetic has been back on the grass at certain points of the last month.And I think the plan is to maybe get him into U21 for a bit. Jayden Danns is also stepping up his recovery. ‚Äú

Well, that was a buffet of information. Liverpool play Tottenham Hotspur next on Saturday in North London. Up the Reds.

title: Late free throws from Suns helps deal Warriors' third straight loss
description: Late free throws from the Suns in the final seconds of the game helped deal the Warriors their third straight loss on Thursday night, 99-98.
fullText:
Heading into Thursday night, the Golden State Warriors were riding a two-game losing streak. In each game, the Warriors held a lead in the fourth quarter, but struggled down the stretch on the way to losses.

On Thursday against the Phoenix Suns, the Warriors failed to close again, despite a heroic performance from Jimmy Butler. Behind Butler, the Warriors built a seven-point lead at halftime, yet heading into the fourth quarter, their lead dwindled down to one.

In the fourth quarter, the Suns took control as momentum swung their way. Yet, Butler, Steph Curry and the Warriors wouldn't go away. In the final minute, the Suns led by five points before Dillon Brooks committed a flagrant foul on Curry, sending him to the line for a pair of free throws. After the free throws from Curry, Butler knocked down a clutch 3-pointer to tie the game at 96. After Booker and Curry traded buckets to tie the game again at 98, Moses Moody committed a late foul on Jordan Goodwin in the final second of the game. Goodwin missed the first attempt from the line before hitting the game-winning free throw and dealt the Warriors their third straight loss, 99-98.

Butler finished with a game-high 31 points on 11-of-17 shooting from the field with three assists and three rebounds in 34 minutes. Butler's performance on Thursday night in Phoenix was his third game of the season scoring 30 or more points. Thursday also marked his highest scoring mark in a month.

Alongside Butler, Brandin Podziemski put together a strong performance on Thursday, scoring 18 points on 8-of-11 shooting from the field with a pair of made 3-pointers in 28 minutes off the bench.

While Podziemski and Butler helped fuel Golden State's offense, Steph Curry struggled, scoring 15 points on 3-of-13 shooting from the field and 2-of-9 from deep. Butler, Podziemski and Curry were the only members of the Warriors to tally double-figure scoring numbers. Draymond Green committed five of Golden State's 20 turnovers.

After their third straight loss, the Warriors have fallen to 13-15 on the season. The Warriors will get the chance to avenge their loss from Thursday when the Suns travel back to the Bay Area on Saturday for a rematch at Chase Center.

This post originally appeared on Warriors Wire! 

This article originally appeared on Warriors Wire: Late free throws from Suns helps deal Warriors' third straight loss

title: Bruno Fernandes reveals he wants to stay and help United win it all
description: Alarm bells started ringing within the halls of Manchester United when the recent interview of Bruno Fernandes began airing.The club captain hinted at INEOS being open to the idea of letting him leave...
fullText:
Alarm bells started ringing within the halls of Manchester United when the recent interview of Bruno Fernandes began airing.

The club captain hinted at INEOS being open to the idea of letting him leave in the summer, but Ruben Amorim and the midfielder‚Äôs family asked the 31-year-old to stay put.

The co-owners were not pleased with the revelation, and plenty of players in the squad feel the Portugal international might be playing at Old Trafford for the final season.

Saudi Pro League sides are expected to return once the summer window opens, while European clubs are also keeping a watch on proceedings.

However, Bruno Fernandes has come out and allayed those fears, claiming he still feels he can win it all for United. And he also revealed that INEOS are also on the same page.

And the 31-year-old feels obligated to help return the club to the heights the fans used to experience almost year back when Sir Alex Ferguson was boss.

‚ÄúObviously, when I speak about going and winning trophies, I stayed here because I think I still can win trophies here,‚Äù he told on Rio Ferdinand‚Äôs podcast.

‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt have stayed here if the club hasn‚Äôt told me our aim is still to get the highest we can be, get back to winning trophies, get back to be the club we were before.

‚ÄúBecause if that was not the aim then, yes, I wouldn‚Äôt have stayed here.

‚ÄúBut [it‚Äôs] because I know the aim of the club is still to get back to where they want to be, and where I want the club to be, and that‚Äôs why I came to the club in the first place.

‚ÄúSo, if I can help to get back there, that‚Äôs all I want to do.‚Äù

United are currently sixth, only two points from fourth position. Returning to the Champions League should be the first step to realising those dreams.

Feature image Shaun Botterill via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Hansi Flick changes Barcelona‚Äôs pre-match routine before Villarreal clash
description: FC Barcelona face off against an injury-riddled Villarreal away at Estadio La Ceramica in their final La Liga clash before the mid-season Christmas break.The contest will take place on Sunday evening,...
fullText:
FC Barcelona face off against an injury-riddled Villarreal away at Estadio La Ceramica in their final La Liga clash before the mid-season Christmas break.

The contest will take place on Sunday evening, with Bar√ßa hoping to go into the break on a winning note, with their healthy lead at the top of the league table intact.

Leading up to the game, SPORT reports that Barcelona manager Hansi Flick is set to make some changes to the team‚Äôs pre-match routine before facing Villarreal.

In the build-up to La Liga matches, whether played at home or away, Barcelona usually follow the same routine. A morning training session at 11 am is held, followed by a press conference from Flick to address the media at 1 pm.

In the Champions League, there are usually some changes, as the structure and organisation of the competition require it.

Hansi Flick has changed things with Barcelona‚Äôs pre-match routine. (Photo by Alex Caparros/Getty Images)

However, ahead of the final league match of the year, which Barcelona will play at La Ceramica against Villarreal this Sunday, the schedule will also be slightly different.

The training session, normally held in the morning, will be moved to the afternoon, taking place immediately after the German tactician‚Äôs press conference, which will take place at its usual time.

The reason for this change is that, once the training session at the Ciutat Esportiva has finished, the team will board a plane to spend Saturday night in the province of Castellon.

Barcelona face the Yellow Submarine at 4:15 pm on Sunday, a kick-off time which, in order to avoid any setbacks, requires the squad to travel a day earlier.

As a result, the final training session has also been moved to the afternoon, before the team begin their journey to Villarreal.

title: Options Missouri football could explore at QB in transfer portal
description: Here are the options that Missouri football could explore at quarterback in the transfer portal.
fullText:
Missouri football is almost certainly going to turn to the transfer portal for a quarterback. A team spokesperson confirmed to the Columbia Daily Tribune on Thursday that starting quarterback Beau Pribula intends to transfer this offseason. The college football transfer portal officially opens Jan. 2.

Now, Mizzou doesn‚Äôt necessarily need a starter. Talented true freshman Matt Zollers is going to start for the Tigers against Virginia in the Gator Bowl on Dec. 27 in Jacksonville, Florida, for his third start with the program.

Missouri may well stick with Zollers moving forward.

But, at the very least, depth is an issue in Columbia heading into 2026. Zollers and incoming true freshman Gavin Sidwar are the only scholarship quarterbacks currently expected to be on the roster next season.

Mizzou definitely needs depth. It might want a starter.

Here are nine players who are currently expected to enter the transfer portal, with three players we think could come in and be instant starters, three would likely be competition and three who likely would be depth behind Zollers:

The following players are the current high-profile options expected to enter the portal. The expectation would be that they could arrive and immediately start.

The general consensus appears to be that Sorsby, if not NFL-bound, is making his way to Lubbock, Texas, to join the big-spending Texas Tech Red Raiders. That shouldn‚Äôt dissuade teams looking for a starter, like Mizzou. The Denton, Texas, native threw for 2,800 yards, 27 touchdowns and five picks this season and also rushed for 580 yards and nine scores.

Everyone and their dog expects Mestemaker to follow his head coach, Eric Morris, from North Texas to Oklahoma State when the portal opens. But ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs not quite so cut and dry, according to a report from Matt Zenitz at 247Sports. If there‚Äôs a window to try and land Mestemaker, there‚Äôs an FBS-leading 4,129 passing yards and 31 touchdowns worth of a reason to enter the bidding war.

This is an expensive option. The demand will be extremely high for the former five-star prospect. But, he‚Äôs in the portal and has a high ceiling, so he‚Äôs certainly worth considering. He threw for 2,000 yards, 18 touchdowns and six interceptions this season.

More: Matt Zollers, big-name transfer or other for Missouri football at QB?

Always compete, as the coaches say. Interest will be high in these players, and Mizzou could offer a chance to come in and battle with Zollers for the starting job.

Joseph had an excellent season at ODU and fits the recent Mizzou mold of a dual-threat. He threw for 2,624 yards, 24 touchdowns and 10 picks, and he added 1,007 rushing yards with 13 touchdowns.

The former Michigan State quarterback beat out former Mizzou player Jake Garcia for the starting job at ECU and had a bit of a comeback year in 2025. He threw for 3,300 yards, 19 touchdowns and six picks, and his offensive coordinator has since been hired as the playcaller at Ole Miss.

Unlikely to be starters, but solid or intriguing depth pieces that shouldn‚Äôt run the risk of running Zollers off.

Dickens is a finalist for the Walter Payton Award, which is given to the most outstanding offensive player at the FCS level. He threw for 3,508 yards, 38 touchdowns and two interceptions this season ‚Äî in nine games. He passed for more yards (582) in a game against Stanford than Texas A&M had total offensive yards (478) against the Bulldogs this year. Worth a look, surely.

Craig has a lot of experience at the FCS level with Harvard, with 28-career games, more than 6,000 passing yards, 52-career touchdowns and 12 interceptions. He has one year of eligibility left.

More: What Missouri football fans need to know about new transfer portal dates

More: Will Jamal Roberts return to Missouri football? Eli Drinkwitz makes plea

Maybe we‚Äôre prisoners of the Trinidad Chambliss moment, but Stokes is a Harlon Hill finalist ‚Äî the Division-II equivalent of the Heisman Trophy ‚Äî¬†and put up some some big passing numbers for Division-II West Florida. He threw for 3,297 yards, 30 touchdowns and 13 picks.

This article originally appeared on Columbia Daily Tribune: Here are Missouri football‚Äôs current transfer portal QB options

title: Dan Quinn excited for Brandon Coleman's return to lineup vs. Eagles
description: Commanders coach Dan Quinn hinted at his earlier disappointment in Brandon Coleman, but loves how he has responded ahead of his start vs. Eagles.
fullText:
Seeing Laremy Tunsil has clearly been the Washington Commanders' MVP this season, with his effective play. What does his absence mean for the Eagles' game at Northwest Stadium, Saturday at 5 p.m. ET?

Brandon Coleman, who had started the season at left guard, then lost his job to Chris Paul, was forced into action replacing Tunsil last Sunday in New York. It was the second time for Coleman to take over for Tunsil. He was also Tunsil's replacement against Kansas City when Tunsil went down with a hamstring injury.

"I think it's really important and the identity piece," head coach Dan Quinn said on Thursday. "And that's what these three weeks are, to me, and why having three division games is so important for us to recapture that north. Yeah, Laremy has been a big part of everything. Run game, pass protection, and so his ability to displace people from the line down on double teams, and Brandon, I thought, really, he had been ready, he was ready, he looked ready, you know, and performed that way."

Quinn was asked what he had seen from Coleman over the past few weeks. Here is how Quinn responded. Let's see if you think Quinn was saying he was initially disappointed that Coleman didn't win back that spot from Chris Paul.

"Yeah, and that's the one spot we haven't been banged up on in that space. And so, obviously disappointed when Chris stepped in and stayed into that space."

The Commanders' head coach then praised the fact that Coleman had been asked to play guard and tackle and had been productive as an extra tight end in some sets. "But then I also saw a guy working guard and tackle. He‚Äôs been our jumbo, you know, so there's some things like, ‚ÄòHey, let's get him back in the fight, get him back into it.'"

Daniels to Noah Brown at the goal line - but LOOK at the block by the rookie Brandon Coleman here üí™üèªüí™üèªüí™üèª pic.twitter.com/MDjuHb2f5i

‚Äî Mark Tyler (Hogs Haven) (@Tiller56) September 24, 2024

Referring to getting Coleman back into it, well, weren't the Commanders designating Coleman a healthy inactive scratch? They certainly did for five consecutive games, and the only comment they offered was that it was a coach's decision, not an injury-related one.

Yet on Thursday, Quinn expressed that he has recently liked the work he has seen from Coleman. "I saw good practice habits number one. So, I wasn't surprised that he performed well because this wasn't a guy that put his head down and sulked about it."

Coaches make decisions that players sometimes understand and sometimes don't, so it can be frustrating for the players. "It's not always smooth, but I thought that showed a lot about his resilience to say, ‚ÄòOkay, yeah, these are not the circumstances that I want, but I'm going to go battle for it.'"

To truly be ready when your name is called, a player must do the classroom work, the field work, and be prepared. Quinn feels Coleman has done just that. "When called or if called, he would show and demonstrate that he was ready... You have to put the work in to do that. And I've certainly seen that from BC."

Coleman has played in nine games this season. Saturday will be his first start since the first two games of the season against the Giants and Packers. In both of those games, he was the starting left guard.

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: Brandon Coleman has massive Week 16 opportunity

title: Celebrate local sports heroes at Wisconsin Rapids awards Jan. 14

fullText:
WISCONSIN RAPIDS ‚àí The Wisconsin Rapids Area Sports Commission has announced the nominees for the 2025 Wisconsin Rapids Area Sports Awards Celebration, according to a community announcement.

The event is scheduled for 5 p.m. Jan. 14 at Bullseye Country Club. It recognizes individuals who have shown commitment, leadership and impact in the local sports community and sports tourism industry.

The event includes three awards: Rookie of the Year, MVP and Lifetime Achievement. The Rookie of the Year Award honors emerging leaders in their first one to two years of involvement. The MVP Award recognizes individuals with at least three years of exceptional leadership and contribution. The Lifetime Achievement Award celebrates those with more than 20 years of impact on the local sports industry and includes induction into the WRASC Hall of Fame.

This year‚Äôs nominees are Ken Hilgers, Phil Jagielo, Klaus Kroner, Wesley Kurzewski, Eric Mellot, Dave Michels and Brian Wendt.

The awards celebration is open to the public. Tickets are $15 in advance or $25 at the door and include a light buffet, networking and cash bar. All proceeds support the WRASC's initiatives.

title: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua purse: How much will each fighter get paid?
description: YouTuber-turned-boxer Paul and former world heavyweight champion Joshua will clash on 19 December
fullText:
Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua will square off in a strange fight tonight, pitting a YouTuber-turned-boxer against a former two-time world heavyweight champion.

Joshua is the latter, to avoid any confusion, with the Briton entering Friday‚Äôs fight in Miami as a huge favourite. ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù holds standout victories over the likes of Wladimir Klitschko, Joseph Parker, Kubrat Pulev, Dillian Whyte and Alexander Povetkin. However, the 36-year-old is entering this bout, which streams live on Netflix, on the back of a brutal stoppage loss to Daniel Dubois in September 2024.

Meanwhile, Paul comes into this contest ‚Äì a professional bout, with knockouts allowed and standard 10oz gloves in use ‚Äì with a 12-1 pro record. The American, 28, last fought in June and outpointed former world middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr, following a decision win over heavyweight legend Mike Tyson last November.

Tyson was 58 at the time, with the fight proving controversial to fans and pundits but lucrative to the boxers; Paul reportedly took home $40m and Tyson $20m.

Now, Paul and Joshua will seemingly clear even Paul‚Äôs payday from that bout ‚Äì and by some distance.

In the days leading up to the confirmation of this bout in November, the Daily Mail reported, ‚ÄúSources tell us that a gargantuan prize pot of around ¬£140m [$184m] has been mooted,‚Äù seemingly to be split evenly between Joshua and Paul. However, Paul later took to X (formerly Twitter) with a different figure, seemingly referencing the fight purse.

Several days after the Mail‚Äôs report was published, Paul tweeted: ‚ÄúStop asking me. $267 Million.‚Äù That works out at approximately ¬£200m.

Sports and entertainment accountant Oriana Morrison told The Independent on Tuesday: ‚ÄúEven if the lower figure ‚Äì the rumoured $184m purse ‚Äì is true, AJ could bring home $92m [¬£70m]. We haven‚Äôt seen a boxing match with a purse at this level since Mayweather vs Pacquiao in 2015 or even Mayweather vs McGregor in 2017. It‚Äôs higher than any Saudi purse to date.‚Äù

Morrison, who was referencing Floyd Mayweather‚Äôs bouts with Manny Pacquiao and Conor McGregor, continued: ‚ÄúThe US never really got the chance to savour Anthony Joshua‚Äôs talent and charisma. This is the perfect setting for this fight and definitely a turning point for boxing in the US.

‚ÄúMVP [Most Valuable Promotions, Paul‚Äôs company] and Jake Paul are dragging new audiences into boxing. They‚Äôre forcing boxing to modernise its promotion and pay fighters better than established promoters.‚Äù

title: A trip to the Rose Bowl set Purdue football's vision for making Rose Bowl
description: Joe Tiller took his Boilermakers on a trip to Pasadena, California, several years before they eventually made the Rose Bowl. More on that foundational moment:
fullText:
Editor's note: This story is the third in a series related to Purdue's 2000 football season.

It's Sept. 13, 2025, a date several members of Purdue football's 2000 Big Ten championship team had eagerly awaited for weeks.

The Boilermakers are hosting USC and, for a bunch of guys who last suited up for the Boilermakers more than two decades earlier, this is a full circle moment.

The two programs hadn't played since the 1998 season opener in Los Angeles.

Purdue lost that game 27 years ago, but what many who were there remember is the day after. Coach Joe Tiller had a planned field trip the players weren't looped in about.

"This was way out of the norm for coach Tiller. He was football, strictly business," safety Ben Smith said. "For him to, one, not make us fly back after the game and, two, take us to the Rose Bowl, we had no idea where we were going.

"We show up there and there‚Äôs the neon lights. He gave us the old coach fire up talk and said, 'Guys, I want you to go out there and feel the grass, look in the stands. I want you to go in the press box and walk around this place and envision before you‚Äôre done playing here, playing in the Rose Bowl.'"

Two years later, Tiller's Boilermakers finished in a three-way tie for the Big Ten title and were the league's representative to play Washington in the Rose Bowl on Jan. 1, 2001.

Survey Purdue's roster during that time period and you'll get various answers on the program-shifting moment that resulted in that Rose Bowl trip. For some, it's that game at USC. Others say Purdue's upset of No. 4 Kansas State in the 1998 Alamo Bowl.

Tiller's second game as Boilermaker coach on Sept. 13, 1997. The roster was a blend of Jim Colletto recruits, who'd been a part of a 3-8 team the season before, and the Big Ten's lowest-rated recruiting class.

"I was in coach Tiller‚Äôs first class. So prior to us getting there, they were nothing," safety Tim Upshur said. "And I'll never forget our first game we played my freshman year was Toledo.

Part 1: How coach Joe Tiller laid foundation for Purdue football's 2000 Rose Bowl team

Part 2: Joe Tiller's coaching staff was 'equally as good' as Purdue football Rose Bowl team

To outsiders, it was same old Purdue. Tiller's postgame message was a sign these Boilermakers were anything but.

"We've got some work to do," he told the team.

Tiller also said the team Purdue would beat Notre Dame the following game. Whether he believed it or not is irrelevant. The players believed that Tiller believed. And then they believed.

Purdue beat Notre Dame for the first time since 1985 in Tiller's second game as head coach on Sept. 13, 1997, seven days after losing his first to Toledo.

"It goes back to that cultural shift," offensive lineman Chukky Okobi said. "You go back to '96 and we can‚Äôt beat anybody and all the sudden we beat Notre Dame in '97. What else can we do? That kind of became the mindset going forward. If we can beat this team, there‚Äôs no reason we can‚Äôt beat every team."

West Lafayette was abuzz over its football program for the first time in years.

"The first game I ever dressed for was '97 against Notre Dame and that was the infamous (game). We win and they throw the goal post in the Wabash (River)," punter Scott Kurz said. "We enjoyed the energy our fans brought. It caught a lot of teams off guard and it was a real special memory for all of us."

Notre Dame was the first of six consecutive wins in what became a 9-3 season, capped by beating Oklahoma State in the Alamo Bowl.

Between 1997-99, Purdue, which hadn't posted a winning record since 1984 previously, went a combined 25-12.

"That's where the great deal of pride I have in this institution today is because I felt like I was a part of turning the tide and changing the narrative of what Purdue football is, what it was and would it could be," said former cornerback Lamar Conard, who was Purdue's running backs coach until a few weeks ago, and whose last season playing was 1999.

All that did was up the ante for that 2000 season, when Tiller's first Purdue recruits would be seniors.

"I remember our recruiting class coming in 1997, we were the last-place ranked recruiting class (in the Big Ten) coming in," quarterback Drew Brees said in an interview with Journal & Courier in 2015. "But we made a commitment to one another that by the time we left Purdue, we were going to be Big Ten champs and we were going to the Rose Bowl. That‚Äôs exactly what we had the chance to do."

Nathan Baird¬†and¬†Sam King¬†have the best Purdue sports coverage, and 

This article originally appeared on Indianapolis Star: Purdue football trip to Rose Bowl helped them envision Rose Bowl berth

title: South para-athlete Violet Hall earns top award from USATF
description: 'Pretty cool' said Hall after being named the country's top high school para track athlete
fullText:
Several weeks ago, USA Track and Field sent out a survey to several athletes asking whether they'd like to be considered for All-American honors.

The email popped into Violet Hall's inbox. The Bloomington South senior figured she was one of hundreds, maybe thousands, to get the query, especially after finding out a couple of friends she'd made while competing in Para track meets over the summer received them as well.

Basically spam, she thought. But, she filled it out, sent it back and forgot all about it.

A couple of days ago, the USATF responded. Hall's friend sent his Para High School All-American certificate, which listed his events. Hall got one too, but hers was different.

"It said, 'Female Athlete of the Year," Hall said. "I said, 'Wait, why is mine different?' I sent it to him, and he said, "Read it. It literally says I won Track Athlete of the Year.' I didn't know. I was confused and then it hit me.

"I sent a screen shot to my parents. Pretty cool."

I am truly grateful and honored to be selected for the USATF Para High School All-American Team and to receive the Female Track Athlete of the Year award. Thank you for this incredible recognition and support!@usatf @USParaTF @JimGordillo @BHSS_Athletics pic.twitter.com/stFEPC3MBL

‚Äî Violet Hall (@violethall2026) December 15, 2025

Pretty cool indeed for Hall, who was one of two high schoolers invited to represent Team USA in track at the Para World Games in New Delhi, India in September.

She qualified in the 100 and 200 dashes in the T47 category. She was fifth in the 200, lowering her PR to 25.50 in the semifinals, and was eighth in the 100 in 12.62.

The trip was a memorable one, though she and her father, who accompanied her, saw more of the inside of her hotel than any tourist traps. Hall spent much of her downtime between her four races, catching up on homework and applying to college.

"Stuff I would have been doing at home," said Hall, who also hit up the hotel pool a few times, the average high that time of year in the mid-90s and lows in the 70s.

Team USA did set up a few trips as a group, but mostly it was a business trip, taking care to eat food prepared for the team to make sure no one got sick.

For her, the experience was everything as a first-time Para World Champ participant. She tried not to put any pressure on herself as a first-timer, just happy to be there and trying to do her best. If she got a medal, great. If not, it was huge just to be there.

"For me, it was more just an experience-building thing," Hall said. "Running against people who have competed in Para circuits and worlds and Paralympics multiple times for 5-10 years.

"So being young an able to get to that point, I have so much more to prove, so much more to do for myself. I hope I can make a big difference and continue to grow."

She has certainly increased her circle of friends in the sport.

"Probably just meeting everyone and competing at that level," Hall said of the best thing about her trip. "Going into it, I had been watching those people race and I was on the line with them. It all happened so fast."

Hall's first Para races took place early in the summer after the IHSAA state track meet ended. Three months later, she was in a massive stadium in India representing her country in a pro-like atmosphere.

"The call room air felt a lot heavier," Hall said. "Not just because of the pressure, but it was also hot. They had fans going and I was sitting right next to one.

"Everyone was in their own bubble. Almost no one was talking. All you could hear was the fans."

More: South's Jasmine Martoglio leads All-Area Girls Cross Country Team

More: North's Jacob Mitchell leads IHSAA All-Area Boys Cross Country team

And after the developments of the past few months, she might be playing for a different set of fans at the college level than what she had envisioned a year ago. Basketball was her main sport and it's still important as South has it's sights set high this season. But track seems more likely in the future.

"It's definitely been a big change, a big shift, from basketball," Hall said. "Going into my junior year, I wouldn't have expected everything to have happened to happen.

"I'm just extremely grateful for the opportunities I've been provided, and grateful God led me through it. I'm just very happy to get to where I am today and excited to continue."

This article originally appeared on The Herald-Times: South para-athlete Violet Hall earns top award from USATF

title: Boys swimming: Butterfly specialists to watch in Central Indiana
description: With the 2025 IHSAA boys swimming season under way, IndyStar is shining a light on five Central Indiana swimmers who excel at the butterfly.
fullText:
With the 2025 IHSAA boys swimming season under way, IndyStar is shining a light on five Central Indiana swimmers who excel at the butterfly.

The senior had an impressive preseason, placing first in the 50 butterfly and second in the 100 and 200 butterfly at the Pike Fall Invitational in late October. At the Plainfield Community Aquatic Club Invitational in early November, Garrity finished second in the 100 butterfly.

The 15th-ranked recruit in the Indiana class of 2027 finished seventh in the 200 butterfly at the Carmel Swim Club Fall Frenzy in early November. Bridges also advanced to the 100 butterfly final at the annual frenzy. Bridges competed in the 100 butterfly final at state earlier this year.

title: Ex-Norwich and Man City defender Hareide dies aged 72
description: Former Norwich City and Manchester City defender, and ex-Denmark and Iceland boss, Aage Hareide dies at the age of 72.
fullText:
Former Norwich City and Manchester City defender Aage Hareide has died at the age of 72.

It was announced last month that Hareide, who won 50 international caps for Norway, including in the famous 2-1 World Cup qualifying victory over England in 1981, was suffering from brain cancer.

Following his playing career, he became a highly successful coach winning domestic trophies in Norway, Denmark and Sweden, and guiding the Danish national team to the 2018 World Cup during a four-year spell in charge.

He had previously managed Norway from 2003 to 2008 and his final coaching role saw him take charge of Iceland in April 2023, only to resign in November 2024, when he also announced his retirement.

One of his finest results as Iceland boss was a 1-0 win over England at Wembley in June 2024, the final game before that year's European Championships for Gareth Southgate's side.

Hareide first came to England to join Manchester City from Molde in 1981 and they finished 10th in the top flight in that season.

He moved on to Norwich the following year and made 52 appearances for the Canaries under then manager Ken Brown.

title: Marcelo names the Barcelona player he would sign for Real Madrid ‚Äì ‚ÄòHe has that Madrid quality‚Äô
description: In a recent interview with DJMario (h/t SPORT), former Real Madrid defender and club legend Marcelo has named the one Barcelona player he would bring to the Santiago Bernabeu.The former left-back, who...
fullText:
In a recent interview with DJMario (h/t SPORT), former Real Madrid defender and club legend Marcelo has named the one Barcelona player he would bring to the Santiago Bernabeu.

The former left-back, who announced his retirement from football earlier this year, named Pedri as his pick ahead of 2025 Ballon d‚ÄôOr runner-up Lamine Yamal, claiming that the Barcelona midfield maestro had that bit of ‚ÄòMadrid quality‚Äô in him.

‚ÄúRight now, I would sign Pedri for Madrid. He has that Madrid quality. Everyone would say Lamine, but I think Pedri would be a better signing,‚Äù said Marcelo.

Pedri has been a key player for Barcelona in recent seasons and was one of the chief driving forces behind their successful 2024/25 campaign under Hansi Flick.

Interestingly, the 23-year-old Spanish international could have been a Real Madrid player, with the club having offered him a trial in the past, only to turn him down.

Marcelo would sign Pedri for Real Madrid. (Photo by Angel Martinez/Getty Images)

‚ÄúWhen I took the test at Valdebebas it was strange; they told me I wasn‚Äôt up to standard and I went home,‚Äú Pedri revealed during an interview about his trial at Real Madrid.

Speaking about his career in football, Marcelo recalled some of the toughest opponents he faced and took a clear stance in favour of Cristiano Ronaldo in the debate against Lionel Messi.

‚ÄúMessi was very tough. Jesus Navas also made it very difficult for me, and I found Xabi Prieto very difficult to defend against too. Pedrito was also very good,‚Äù said Marcelo.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll always go with Cristiano. Messi is incredible. We‚Äôve enjoyed both of them, well, I‚Äôve only enjoyed one. I‚Äôm a die-hard Cristiano fan,‚Äù he noted.

Even though it has been a few years since he left the club, the Marcelo family legacy will continue through his son Enzo, who plays in the Real Madrid youth ranks and is an international with Spain.

‚ÄúEnzo is doing well. He feels the pressure of being my son, but as he has grown up in the Madrid dressing room, he is now realising who the players are. They have seen him grow up, they have taken him under their wing,‚Äù said Marcelo.

‚ÄúNow he realises that what he has experienced is not normal. He is happy and content. I love that he is playing for Spain. The national team has been very good to us. They are very fond of my son. He made the decision and he‚Äôs very happy,‚Äù he concluded.

title: Napoli‚Äôs official statement as Allegri appears to insult Conte‚Äôs assistant Oriali
description: Milan coach Massimiliano Allegri appeared to insult Antonio Conte‚Äôs assistant Gabriele Oriali during the final minutes of the Supercoppa semifinal between the Rossoneri and Napoli, prompting the Par...
fullText:
Milan coach Massimiliano Allegri appeared to insult Antonio Conte‚Äôs assistant Gabriele Oriali during the final minutes of the Supercoppa semifinal between the Rossoneri and Napoli, prompting the Partenopei to react with an official statement: ‚ÄòWe hope it won‚Äôt go unnoticed.‚Äô

Tension erupted in Riyadh last night as Napoli beat Milan 2-0 in a Supercoppa Italiana semifinal.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì NOVEMBER 23: AC Milan coach Massimiliano Allegri reacts during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and AC Milan at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on November 23, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Players clashed in the final minutes, while the coaches left the field without shaking their hands.

Sportmediaset published a video that appears to show Allegri insulting Conte‚Äôs assistant, and Italy legend Lele Oriali, on the touchline at minute 89, with Napoli already leading 2-0.

Allegri seemed to call Oriali ‚Äòcoglione‚Äô, which translates into ‚Äòas*hole‚Äô and Napoli reacted with an official statement: ‚ÄúNapoli strongly condemn the conduct of Milan head coach Massimiliano Allegri who, during the Supercoppa Italiana semifinal, in the presence of dozens of people on the sidelines and live on TV, repeatedly and seriously insulted Gabriele Oriali using offensive language,‚Äù the Partenopei said.

‚ÄúWe hope that this completely uncontrolled outburst won‚Äôt go unnoticed, especially given that with 33 cameras involved in the production of the event, it is impossible not to acknowledge what happened.‚Äù

Napoli will face the winner of Bologna-Inter in the Supercoppa Final on Monday, December 22.

Having already been eliminated from the Coppa Italia and not being involved in any European competition this season, Milan only have Serie A left to play for this season.
