fullText:
Luka Donƒçiƒá records one of the most absurd statlines of all time originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers traveled to Utah to face the Jazz in what, seemingly, was a very winnable game going into it.

It was the Lakers' second game without star Austin Reaves, and they also took the opportunity to rest some other guys with lingering injuries like DeAndre Ayton and Gabe Vincent.

This game became anything but very winnable. Utah came out and gave it everything they had in what turned out to be a dogfight down the stretch.

LeBron James had another game where he slowly started looking like himself again, posting 28 points, but the story of the night was clearly Luka Donƒçiƒá as he posted one of the most insane stat lines in NBA history.

Luka Donƒçiƒá had one of those nights that not only remind everyone what an absolute weapon he is, but also reinforce that when he takes the floor, we're witnessing the MVP of the league this season.

Donƒçiƒá went out tonight and recorded 45 points, 14 assists, 10 rebounds, and a whopping five steals. This is not only one of the impressive stat lines of the season, but one of the craziest triple-doubles in the history of the league.

Luka Doncic tonight

Donƒçiƒá became just the second player ever to post a 45-point triple-double while also recording five steals.

title: 2025 NCAA volleyball championship preview: Time, starters, X-factors
description: Kentucky and Texas A&M will meet in the first all-SEC national volleyball championship game on Sunday.
fullText:
The field of 64 teams in the 2025 NCAA volleyball tournament is down to the championship with the No. 1 Kentucky Wildcats and No. 3 seed Texas A&M Aggies remaining. They will face off in the first all-SEC national championship game on Sunday, Dec. 21 (3:30 p.m. ET, ABC) at the T-Mobile Center in Kansas City.

Texas A&M is looking to take its best season in program history even further. The Aggies are vying for their first title in their first championship appearance after upsetting No. 1 overall seed Nebraska and No. 1 Pitt in the Elite Eight and Final Four, respectively. Meanwhile, Kentucky is looking to win its second title and first since 2020 after getting past No. 3 Wisconsin in a thrilling five-set semifinal win.

Here's a preview of the national championship, including lineups and X-factors to keep an eye on:

title: Igor Shesterkin Propels Rangers To Win Over Blues, Showing Why He's ‚ÄòAn Elite Goaltender‚Äô In The NHL
description: It wasn‚Äôt pretty, but the New York Rangers came away with a 2-1 win over the St. Louis Blues on Thursday night.
fullText:
It wasn‚Äôt pretty, but the New York Rangers came away with a 2-1 win over the St. Louis Blues on Thursday night.

Going into this matchup, the Rangers had lost two consecutive games while only scoring one goal in the process.

Mike Sullivan‚Äôs response was to call up Gabe Perreault and Brennan Othmann from the Hartford Wolf Pack of the American Hockey League, who both slotted into the lineup.

Despite a strong first period where the Rangers led 10-5 in shots and dominated possession time for the most part, an offensive zone turnover led to a goal from Jonatan Berggren, putting the Blueshirts in an early 1-0 hole.

The Rangers came out aggressive in the second period, and on the power play, Will Cuylle took a shot that deflected off of Perreault‚Äôs foot for his first career NHL goal.

‚ÄúI kind of blacked out,‚Äù Perreault said about his goal. ‚ÄúPretty lucky one, but feels good to get the first one.‚Äù

After 40 minutes, the Rangers held a 25-15 edge in shots and felt they were outplaying the Blues.

‚ÄúI thought for the first two periods, we did a really good job,‚Äù Sullivan said. ‚ÄúI thought we were playing on top of them. We established a lot of offensive zone time.‚Äù

The Rangers‚Äô game began to falter in the third period.

St. Louis began dictating the pace of play, creating multiple high-quality scoring chances, which put the Rangers on their heels for the majority of the final frame.

It was the heroics of Igor Shesterkin that helped the Rangers escape into overtime. Shesterkin made 11 critical saves down the stretch, and when the Blueshirts broke down defensively, their superstar goalie was there to bail them out.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great,‚Äù J.T. Miller said of having Igor Shesterkin in net. ‚ÄúWe talk about it all the time, it‚Äôs such a luxury to have. Even when it‚Äôs Quick in there, we are so lucky to have those guys, and obviously total confidence in them. It was on display again tonight.‚Äù

Shesterkin made 26 saves on the night, and his performance left Blues head coach¬†Jim Montgomery nothing but impressed.

"Shesterkin's an elite goaltender in this league,‚Äù¬†Montgomery said. ‚ÄúHe showed that tonight.‚Äù

In overtime, Miller buried the game-winning goal to propel the Rangers to a hard-fought victory.

Miller has recorded three overtime goals this season, joining Tomas Sandstrom, Adam Graves, and Marian Gaborik as the only Rangers players to accomplish this feat.

‚ÄúIt's good for the confidence,‚Äù Miller said of his three overtime goals. ‚ÄúLast couple weeks, I feel like my games there. I don't think it's kind of back to the same as the beginning of the year. It's like not getting as much as I'd like, I think, on the scoresheet. But I got to believe that if you just play like that most games than not over the course of the season, good things will happen. Just try to be confident.‚Äù

Adam Fox Returns To Practice For The First Time Since Suffering Injury It appears as if Adam Fox is making strides in his recovery from an upper-body injury. 

While this performance certainly wasn‚Äôt anything to write home about, Sullivan was pleased with the way his team played, specifically from the standpoint of playing with the right intentions in the offensive zone.

‚ÄúI thought our intentions as far as getting to the net front, getting inside a little bit more was better tonight,‚Äù Sullivan emphasized. ‚ÄúI thought we had more looks just by getting inside and trying to create off the shot. I do think the guys are listening in that regard, just trying to create more off the shot.‚Äù

The Rangers will be back in action on Saturday afternoon against the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Sam Darnold stats: How Seahawks QB led comeback win over Rams to take NFC West lead

Sam Darnold was headed towards another rough performance against the Los Angeles Rams on Thursday night, but he turned it around to produce perhaps the best win of his career.

The Seattle Seahawks were down 30-16 in the fourth quarter, as Darnold had a couple turnovers to put Seattle in a hole. From there, with a little luck and help from his receivers, Darnold brought the Seahawks back to not only win the game, but clinch a playoff spot and take control of the NFC's No. 1 seed.

Darnold's career has been full of rough moments, so it must've felt good for him to produce a high-level comeback on national television in such a big game. Here's a look at how Darnold performed against the Rams.

Darnold's numbers didn't pop on Thursday night, but he turned it on when it mattered the most. All four of Darnold's touchdowns and two-point conversions came in the fourth quarter and overtime, which followed his two early second-half interceptions.

Darnold had a quiet first half, as Seattle leaned on the running game and defense. Additionally, it appeared that Darnold was headed for another rough night against the Rams, who had his number previously, when he threw two interceptions.

However, Darnold turned it around from there, leading the Seahawks to a 16-point comeback and overtime win. The veteran quarterback produced two touchdowns and two two-point conversions, as every point mattered in the win.

The tournament begins on December 11 and will end on January 3 (there are some days off in between for holidays).

The World Championship is one of a handful of darts tournaments that feature a set format, with the number of sets a player has to win increasing as the tournament progresses:

First and second round: best-of-5 sets

Third and fourth round: best-of-7 sets

Each set is played to best-of-5 legs. If a match went to a last-set decider, a player must win the final set by at least two legs, or win a sudden-death leg if the players were even through 10 legs in the final set.

title: Seattle Seahawks accomplish feat never done in franchise history vs. Rams
description: The Seattle Seahawks accomplished a feat that had never been done in franchise history until their wild win over the Los Angeles Rams on Thursday Night Football.

title: Seahawks pull off largest 4th quarter comeback in franchise history
description: Down 16? No problem for the ‚ÄòTeam of Destiny‚Äô Seahawks.
fullText:
Can you win the game in the fourth quarter?!! Well, the Seattle Seahawks technically didn‚Äôt, because they needed overtime to beat the Los Angeles Rams.

After falling behind 30-14, Sam Darnold threw what looked to be a game-clinching interception to Kobie Turner. That should‚Äôve been a wrap given the Seahawks hadn‚Äôt forced a punt all night on defense and the offense was mostly on the struggle bus again.

Rashid Shaheed‚Äôs 58-yard punt return touchdown sparked what is the greatest 4th quarter comeback in Seattle‚Äôs 50 seasons of existence.

Rashid Shaheed showing that SPEED

LARvsSEA on Prime Video
Also streaming on @NFLPlus pic.twitter.com/I5o5WNalk6

An A.J. Barner touchdown, followed by the craziest two-point conversion ever, and then an overtime Octopus from Sam Darnold, Jaxon Smith-Njigba, and Eric Saubert (!!!) wrapped up an astonishing 38-37 win for the Seahawks.

Prior to Thursday night, the Seahawks were 0-172 when trailing by 15+ points in the fourth quarter. Guess what? They‚Äôre now 1-172. I guess they were due, and that‚Äôs the difference between likely playing for the Wild Card and leading the NFC West with two weeks to go. At this moment, the Seahawks are the NFC‚Äôs No. 1 seed thanks to one of the craziest comebacks in franchise history, and dare I say NFL history given the context and flow of that game.

title: Londynn Jones career night catapults USC to 86-39 win over Cal Poly Mustangs
description: LOS ANGELES ‚Äî Another convincing win for the USC Trojans' Women's basketball squad as they made quick work of the Cal Poly Mustangs by a lopsided 86-39 final.
fullText:
LOS ANGELES ‚Äî Another convincing win for the USC Trojans' Women's basketball squad as they made quick work of the Cal Poly Mustangs by a lopsided 86-39 final. Londynn Jones had herself a career night against the Mustangs in front of the 3,511 spectators at the Galen Center, dropping 28 points on 11-16 shooting and 4 steals.

Coming into Thursday night, the Trojans were coming off the trail of an ugly loss at home last Saturday to the best team in the country, the UConn Huskies, and with a great week of practice following the loss, according to USC Head Coach Lindsay Gottlieb, she was encouraged by how the Women of Troy would respond to Cal Poly.

"I just wanted to use my time to be as clear with film and messaging as I could to lead us in the right direction," Gottlieb said on how she utilized the days off after the UConn loss to hone in on the mistakes that were easily noticeable during film sessions, even prefacing to her team and staff that the UConn film session would not be a "pretty" session.

Despite the poor film session, Gottlieb expressed her enthusiasm for the encouraging aspects the film provided, as the team quickly identified their mistakes and was able to work on them easily in preparation for their Thursday matchup.

"While we got it handed to us, we also saw things that we could've done better immediately, saw things we could improve at, and what we wanted to see was a team that was more intentional defensively," Gottlieb said on the upside of their latest film session.

The Women of Troy must have received the memo, as they came out of the gates hot in the first half, and they went on two individual scoring runs that separated them from the Mustangs. An early 12-0 run in the middle of the first quarter and a 7-0 run heading into the locker room for halftime had the Trojans up 45-23.

Jones was torching it up offensively, leading the team with 18 first-half points on 7-9 shooting, including 3-5 from beyond the arc. Jazzy Davidson led right behind her with 7 points, but was being more frugal on the offensive side and was more active on the defensive end, snagging 6 rebounds in 18 minutes.

The second half was no different and was kicked into second gear as Jones and Davidson had 10 points each, and the entire team locked up any chances for Cal Poly to start any offense. At one point in the game, the Women of Troy had themselves a 50-point lead in the final minutes of the 4th quarter and had a 19-0 run in the second half as well.

"I'm just happy that we're starting to figure out how to put the pieces together, and it's been something that we've been emphasizing during practice," Jones said after USC's win and reflection on her 28-point night.

With this win, the Women of Troy improve to 8-3 on the season and have one more game up north against the California Golden Bears before taking eight days off to play Nebraska on December 29.

title: David Ornstein names candidate who ‚Äúis going to be a Chelsea manager‚Äù
description: The Athletic journalist David Ornstein has named the candidate who ‚Äúis going to be a Chelsea manager‚Äù amidst Enzo Maresca doubts.This week has seen a whole lot of drama bubble up at Stamford Bridg...
fullText:
The Athletic journalist David Ornstein has named the candidate who ‚Äúis going to be a Chelsea manager‚Äù amidst Enzo Maresca doubts.

This week has seen a whole lot of drama bubble up at Stamford Bridge surrounding head coach Maresca.

There was some breaking news yesterday, actually from Ornstein as well, suggesting that Manchester City were eyeing Maresca as a top candidate to replace Pep Guardiola, who looks like he could depart the club in the summer.

Maresca actually did his best Pep Guardiola impression after Chelsea‚Äôs win over Cardiff in midweek, claiming he was ‚Äúvery happy‚Äù while looking anything but. It was as unsettling as you could imagine‚Ä¶

Things are certainly not right there, and we can all clearly see that there is a lot of tension between the Chelsea manager and the board room right now.

How will it end? Well, personally I can only see Maresca leaving Chelsea in the summer, or being sacked. Likely some sort of mutual agreement will happen.

Liam Rosenior managing Strasbourg. (Photo by George Wood/Getty Images)

Ornstein, speaking on The Athletic Podcast yesterday with words from it cited on X, said:

‚ÄúThere are many people who already saying Liam Rosenior at Strasbourg is going to be a Chelsea manager in the future, whether it‚Äôs in the immediate or medium or longer term. And that shows their contingency plans, like all well organized top clubs will be in place in one way, shape or form.‚Äù

You read stories and situations and this is just one of them that feels like it will happen, like it is inevitable.

Rosenior to replace Maresca at Chelsea this summer? I‚Äôd certainly not be putting any money against that happening.

title: Arkansas State upends Missouri State 34-28 in inaugural Xbox Bowl
description: Arkansas State completes mission of winning season and unlocks a new achievement in Frisco, TX.
fullText:
Arkansas State unlocked a significant achievement Thursday night in Frisco, TX.

The Red Wolves emerged victorious in the inaugural Xbox Bowl, taking down first-year FBS program Missouri State 34-28 in the first college football game played at the Ford Center inside The Star ‚Äî the practice facility of the Dallas Cowboys.

Immediately after Master Chief from Halo handled the coin toss, Arkansas State wasted no time in completing a successful mission, pouncing on its competition to manufacture a lead as great as 31-7. Missouri State stared down the red ring of death but didn‚Äôt disconnect its controller. The Bears‚Äô instead fought to the finish but failed to recover a late onside kick, watching a successful inaugural season conclude in heartbreaking fashion.

Arkansas State relied on the arm of veteran quarterback Jaylen Raynor, whose passing attributes looked maxed out at 99 overall for much of Thursday night. The junior finished 17-of-31 with 288 yards, delivering three touchdowns to three different targets. On the Red Wolves‚Äô opening series, he delivered a strike to a 7-yard touchdown Jaylen Bonelli. He continued his rampage with a 71-yard sideline deep shot to sixth-year senior receiver Corey Rucker ‚Äî a longtime Arkansas State standout playing his final collegiate game. Then to manufacture a 24-7 halftime lead, the quarterback played pitch and catch with Chauncy Cobb, who caught a 4-yard touchdown set up by one of Raynor‚Äôs several successful deep balls.

Rucker, who exceeded 100 yards in Arkansas State‚Äôs 2024 bowl victory, concluded his college career on a spectacular note. He posted 166 yards and a touchdown on six catches, exceeding 160 for the fifth time in Red Wolves colors. Rucker already held designation as the program‚Äôs career leader in receiving yards, but on his lone touchdown, he moved into sole possession of first place on Arkansas State‚Äôs all-time receiving touchdowns list, breaking a tie with Omar Bayless.

Missouri State‚Äôs seventh-year quarterback Jacob Clark also saw a noble sendoff despite a losing effort, firing for 349 yards and four touchdowns against the Sun Belt opponent. However, the quarterback ‚Äî who had been sacked more than any other QB in the FBS this year ‚Äî was upended in the backfield all game long by an Arkansas State defense which generated nine sacks. Missouri State‚Äôs offensive line looked like it accidentally set the difficulty to Heisman mode, as Arkansas State defensive linemen Ethan Hassler, Demarcus Hendricks, and Cody Silger all frequented the hit stick to register multiple sacks in a pure domination.

With that immense pressure, Missouri State‚Äôs offense severely lagged, punting on seven of its first eight possessions. Because its lone touchdown over that 8-drive span was a 39-yard completion to Dash Luke, the Bears never snapped the ball inside the Arkansas State 35-yard line until roughly one minute remained in the third quarter. With Luke thriving in the second half behind a 7-reception, 169-yard, 2-touchdown performance, Missouri State‚Äôs offense surged late, but the Bears were in too deep of a hole with too time to fully climb out.

Missouri State (7-6, 5-3 CUSA) still finished its first FBS season above .500 ‚Äî a remarkable accomplishment for the program. Now that the Bears checked off their first box of playing in a bowl game, in 2026 they‚Äôll look to move one step further by managing a bowl victory. Leading the charge will be SMU offensive coordinator Casey Woods, who is slated to accept the Missouri State head coaching position later in the week, as the team transitions to year two.

Arkansas State (7-6, 5-3 Sun Belt) wins its second-straight bowl game under head coach Butch Jones. The Red Wolves never won a single bowl until 2012, but now six bowl trophies will reside in their facilities when they return to Jonesboro. With the win, Arkansas State clinched back-to-back winning campaigns for the first time since its fruitful 2011-19 stretch, concluding the 2025 season with a new achievement in the inaugural Xbox Bowl.

title: Lasses Player Analysis: Never Fall In Love With A Loanee? Too Late!
description: Keira Barry has made a huge impact at Sunderland since joining from Manchester United. Charlotte Patterson explains why!
fullText:
When Sunderland AFC Women announced the loan signing of Manchester United forward Keira Barry ahead of the 2025/2026 campaign, the move was framed as a mutually beneficial opportunity: a talented young attacker seeking consistent senior minutes and a fiercely ambitious club eager to sharpen its cutting edge in the final third.

Barry arrived on Wearside with a growing reputation, a hunger for responsibility, and a r√©sum√© that already included Manchester United academy pedigree, England youth caps, and a successful loan spell at Crystal Palace during their 2024 Barclays Women‚Äôs Championship title‚Äëwinning season.

What follows is a period that not only validated Sunderland‚Äôs faith in her but also accelerated Barry‚Äôs evolution into one of the most dynamic young forwards in the domestic game.

Her early interviews revealed a player who immediately felt at home; Barry spoke openly about how quickly she connected with the environment, praising the inclusivity and ambition of the club and describing Sunderland as ‚Äúone big team‚Äù with a culture that matched her own work ethic and aspirations.

That sense of belonging translated directly into her performances. From her first appearances, she played with the confidence of someone who understood both the opportunity and the responsibility placed upon her shoulders.

Barry‚Äôs impact became visible not only in her goals but in the way she reshaped Sunderland‚Äôs attacking identity.

Her first major headline moment arguably came in the high‚Äëprofile derby against Newcastle United Women at St James‚Äô Park, where she scored Sunderland‚Äôs only goal in a 3‚Äì1 defeat ‚Äî a strike that showcased her instinctive movement and composure under pressure. Though the result didn‚Äôt fall Sunderland‚Äôs way, Barry‚Äôs performance stood out during a difficult afternoon, reinforcing her growing importance to the side.

However, many could argue that their first real taste of what Barry could offer was when she came off the bench against Birmingham as the entire tempo of Sunderland‚Äôs attack shifted. She immediately injected urgency and imagination, and her most audacious moment arrived when she spotted the goalkeeper off her line and attempted an outrageous lob from close to the halfway line.

It was the kind of instinctive, high‚Äëskill effort that only a player brimming with confidence and flair even considers, let alone executes cleanly.

For a split second, the stadium held its breath as the ball arced through the air ‚Äî a reminder that Barry possesses not just technical quality but the boldness to try something spectacular when others might play it safe. It was nearly a match‚Äëwinning moment and an example of her fearless mentality.

What made Barry‚Äôs season so far so compelling wasn‚Äôt simply the goals she scored but the completeness of her attacking profile.

She arrived as a forward with raw pace, sharp instincts, and a reputation for directness, but has developed into a far more nuanced and influential presence. Her style of play blended technical precision with relentless energy, makes her a constant threat whether she was leading the line, drifting wide, or dropping between the lines to link play.

Barry‚Äôs main attacking strengths are her ability to manipulate defenders with a combination of close control and explosive acceleration.

Her dribbling ability has become one of Sunderland‚Äôs most reliable weapons. She has a knack for carrying the ball at speed without losing balance or awareness, often gliding past opponents with a single touch or a subtle change of direction. This isn‚Äôt showmanship for its own sake ‚Äî it‚Äôs purposeful, vertical, and always aimed at destabilising defensive structures. Additionally, Barry‚Äôs dribbling is the kind that forces opponents to retreat, reshaping the pitch in Sunderland‚Äôs favour and creating space for teammates to exploit.

Her pace is also a defining feature of her game.

Barry possesses not only straight‚Äëline speed but also the ability to accelerate sharply in tight spaces. This makes her particularly dangerous in transitional moments, where Sunderland‚Äôs counterattacking sequences often begin with a simple ball into her path.

Once in stride, few defenders can match her and her tenacity amplifies this threat. She chases down loose balls, presses aggressively from the front, and refuses to let defenders settle. Even when she doesn‚Äôt win possession directly, her pressure frequently forces hurried clearances or turnovers that Sunderland can capitalise on.

However, Barry‚Äôs game isn‚Äôt built solely on physical attributes. One of the most impressive aspects of her development is her reading of the game.

She demonstrates an increasingly sophisticated understanding of timing ‚Äî when to drop deep, when to spin in behind, when to hold her run, and when to attack the near post. Her movement is often a study in anticipation and she reads defensive lines with the intuition of a seasoned striker, often arriving in pockets of space a fraction of a second before her marker.

This intelligence makes her a consistent outlet for Sunderland‚Äôs midfielders and full backs, who‚Äôve quickly learned to trust her runs.

Her reading of the game also extends to her link‚Äëup play, and her ability to combine with teammates improved markedly as the season progressed.

She‚Äôa developed a strong rapport with Sunderland‚Äôs wide players ‚Äî particularly Katie Kitching in the ten ‚Äî frequently exchanging quick passes to break pressure or create overloads. Her first touch, already a strength, has become even more reliable under pressure, allowing her to receive the ball in tight areas and either turn sharply or lay it off with precision. This makes her not only a finisher but also a facilitator, someone who can knit together attacking sequences and elevate the players around her.

Her crossing has become one of the most distinctive and dangerous elements of her game, the kind of delivery that can tilt the rhythm of a match in Sunderland‚Äôs favour almost instantly.

Barry has a natural feel for shaping the ball into areas defenders hate ‚Äî teasing, dipping crosses that force centre backs to turn, hesitate, or overcommit. Whether she drives to the byline or cuts inside onto her stronger foot, she delivers with a blend of precision and imagination, often picking out runners with a level of consistency that makes her a trusted outlet in wide areas. Her ability to cross at full speed without breaking stride adds an extra layer of unpredictability, turning even half‚Äëchances into genuine opportunities and giving Sunderland a reliable source of creativity whenever the game becomes tight.

Her shot, meanwhile, carries a wickedness that sets her apart from many forwards of her age. Barry strikes the ball with a venomous combination of technique and intent, generating power that belies her frame and accuracy that punishes even the smallest defensive lapse.

She can whip a shot across goal with minimal backlift, catch keepers off-guard with early strikes, or unleash rising efforts from the edge of the box that demand spectacular saves. What‚Äôs made her shooting truly dangerous is her confidence: she never hesitates to pull the trigger when space opens, and her ability to generate both pace and swerve means that even well‚Äëpositioned goalkeepers find her efforts difficult to read.

It‚Äôs the kind of finishing that doesn‚Äôt just score goals ‚Äî it changes the momentum of matches.

Consistency has become one of Barry‚Äôs defining traits and even during matches where Sunderland havestruggled collectively, the level of her individual performances rarely dipped.

She brings the same intensity, intelligence, and technical quality week after week, and has established herself as one of the most dependable figures in the squad. Her work rate has never wavered and her willingness to track back, press, and contribute defensively makes her invaluable in a league where the margins are often razor‚Äëthin.

Statistically, Barry‚Äôs contributions are significant.

She‚Äôs scored in key fixtures ‚Äî including a derby goal against Newcastle United Women ‚Äî and her involvement in Sunderland‚Äôs attacking phases extends far beyond goals alone. Her chance creation numbers have risen steadily, reflecting her growing influence as both a scorer and provider.

Although Sunderland‚Äôs overall results have fluctuated, Barry‚Äôs individual metrics such as progressive carries, successful dribbles, shots on target, and pressing actions consistently rank among the highest in the squad. These statistics underscore what is evident to anyone watching: she‚Äôs becoming a complete forward.

Her background has provided context for this rapid progression.

Barry had already experienced senior football with Manchester United, making her debut in December 2022 in a League Cup match against Sheffield United. She has also represented England at U19 level, scoring once in five appearances.

Her loan spell at Crystal Palace during their 2024 title‚Äëwinning campaign gave her a taste of high‚Äëstakes football and the demands of a promotion push, and by the time she arrived at Sunderland, she was no longer a prospect but a player ready to take on a central role.

Sunderland‚Äôs environment proves ideal for her next stage of growth and the club‚Äôs ambition, culture, and emphasis on hard work aligns perfectly with her mentality.

Barry herself highlighted this fit, noting that Sunderland ‚Äúalways puts the graft in‚Äù ‚Äî a quality she values deeply. This synergy between player and club created the conditions for her breakout season and as the 2025/2026 campaign continues, Barry‚Äôs influence extends beyond the pitch.

Her professionalism, attitude, and commitment have made her a respected figure within the squad. Younger players look up to her despite being young herself, whilst her senior teammates appreciate her reliability and drive. She embodies the blend of talent and work ethic that Sunderland has sought to cultivate.

Barry‚Äôs season so far will be remembered as a pivotal chapter in her career; a period of accelerated growth, consistent excellence, and undeniable impact.

She arrived as a talented young forward seeking opportunities and will leave in January (or hopefully not, if we can extend her loan deal) as one of the most exciting attacking players in the league. Her dribbling ability, pace, tenacity, reading of the game, and attacking instincts combined to create a player capable of changing matches on her own. Her performances have not only been consistently good but often decisive, elevating Sunderland‚Äôs attacking threat and giving the supporters a glimpse of a star in the making.

In the broader landscape of women‚Äôs football, Barry‚Äôs half-season with the club stands as a testament to the value of strategic loans, supportive environments, and the importance of giving young players meaningful responsibility.

Sunderland has provided a platform and Barry provided the brilliance. Together, they created a story of growth, ambition, and success that‚Äôll be remembered long after the final whistle of the season ‚Äî despite the mixed performances from the club as a whole.

If her trajectory continues on its current path, the 2025/2026 campaign will be seen not as the peak but as the beginning ‚Äî a season that unlocked her potential and set the stage for an exceptional career at the highest level.

I only hope we can extend her loan to the end of the season and maybe ‚Äî just maybe, dear reader ‚Äî we can pull off a miracle and acquire her services permanently.

title: Good Luck, Boys ‚Äî Do Sunderland Proud At AFCON!
description: ‚ÄúIf we want to attract young, ambitious and talented players, this is the tradeoff we need to accept‚Äù
fullText:
It‚Äôs a mark of the huge impact they‚Äôve made and their popularity with the fans that Sunday‚Äôs Wear-Tyne derby felt a tad bittersweet as we were treated to the sight of Sunderland‚Äôs AFCON-eligible players turning in yet another exceptionally gutsy performance before they bade a temporary farewell to Wearside in order to represent their countries in Morocco.

Beating Newcastle United at home in front of a packed house before jetting off in the hope of winning silverware at Africa‚Äôs biggest footballing jamboree? Not the worst note on which to temporarily sign off!

Of course, when we added these lads to the ranks in the summer, we did so in the hope that we‚Äôd possibly signed some previously undiscovered or overlooked gems ‚Äî but in the knowledge that we‚Äôd have to deal with plenty of international absences during the 2025/2026 season.

That was the balance we had to strike ‚Äî not least to ensure we brought players to Wearside who could build on what we achieved in 2024/2025 and to give ourselves the best possible chance of being competitive in the Premier League. Running the risk of paying the dreaded ‚ÄúEnglish tax‚Äù? No thanks. We widened the scope of our search for talent, tapped into new markets and came up trumps.

However, for Reinildo, Noah Sadiki, Chemsdine Talbi, Arthur Masuaku, Bertrand Traor√© and club record signing Habib Diarra ‚Äî somewhat controversially called up by Senegal after a lengthy injury layoff ‚Äî signing off with a victory over Newcastle could hardly have been a more fitting note.

Will we miss them? Of course ‚Äî even though we‚Äôve got along just fine in the absence of midfield powerhouse Diarra ‚Äî but I can‚Äôt deny the sense of pride I feel at having so many Sunderland players considered among the best their countries have to offer, and it‚Äôll be a real boon for the club as they compete for victory at AFCON.

If we want to attract young, ambitious and talented players, this is the tradeoff we need to accept.

Every one of these lads has contributed significantly in their own way ‚Äî a ringing endorsement of the standard of Sunderland‚Äôs summer recruitment and the way in which they‚Äôve acquitted themselves since signing. They‚Äôve evidently won the trust of R√©gis Le Bris through their application, ability and sheer will to win, and they‚Äôre clearly fully invested in what‚Äôs taking shape at Sunderland.

Only Masuaku hasn‚Äôt really made a huge impact, yet former Atl√©tico Madrid left back Reinildo is making a strong case for being one of the Stadium of Light era‚Äôs shrewdest free transfers.

Talbi is an immensely exciting talent; Traor√© is a wily and industrious winger and Sadiki and Diarra ‚Äî along with Granit Xhaka ‚Äî formed what was a hugely promising midfield trio before Diarra was struck by injury, so it‚Äôs natural that we‚Äôll be poorer for their absence and required to adapt.

However, despite this mass exodus of talent, there‚Äôll be no panic from Le Bris or the coaching staff.

We‚Äôve known for some time that AFCON absences would represent one of our major challenges and we certainly won‚Äôt be heading into this period unprepared and unsure as to what to do. With the January transfer window not far off, two avenues will converge: that of phasing new recruits into the side and eventually welcoming back the lads from Morocco, which will hopefully enable us to mount a strong push during the latter half of the season.

In practical terms, this may mean that the likes of Chris Rigg, Dennis Cirkin, Romaine Mundle, Dan Neil and 2024 AFCON winner Simon Adingra ‚Äî overlooked by the Cote D‚ÄôIvoire for this tournament yet a hugely talented player nonetheless ‚Äî find themselves back in the fold during the coming weeks, with all kinds of speculation about potential system changes and the like.

I do believe that even in the absence of the players mentioned, we have enough strength in depth to cope.

It may mean the possibility of one or two unorthodox positional changes for the players who remain ‚Äî Lutsharel Geertruida is someone I‚Äôm particularly eager to see more of ‚Äî as well as a change of shape for the team as a whole, but so strong is our team spirit and the collective desire to win, there‚Äôll be no question of their willingness to slot in where needed. That‚Äôs a basic requirement and would be for any player attempting to make a push for a first team berth.

This season, we‚Äôve seen Trai Hume and Dan Ballard striding through games for Northern Ireland. Robin Roefs is very firmly in the mix with the Netherlands, and we‚Äôve also seen Omar Alderete dishing out his own brand of vigilante justice when Paraguay took on the United States. Now it‚Äôs time for our ‚ÄúSuper Six‚Äù to take centre stage and with any luck, they‚Äôll be blessed and reign down in Africa.

Good luck, boys. Go well, represent your countries with pride, passion and commitment, and we‚Äôll be ready to welcome you back once it‚Äôs over ‚Äî hopefully for what‚Äôll be a memorable second half of the 2025/2026 season!

title: Reinildo Mandava: Sunderland‚Äôs Unsung Summer Gem
description: Granit Xhaka is undoubtedly the signing of the season. For me, Reinildo sits comfortably in second place behind him.
fullText:
With the celebrations of the derby win still keeping us warm and fulfilled as the dismal weather continues and the shortest day of the year draws near, the name of Granit Xhaka is still dominating discussions. Finally, some of the ‚Äúexpert‚Äù pundits have begun to recognise what we Sunderland fans have known for several months ‚Äì our captain is the Premier League signing of the season.

He has set standards, demonstrated leadership, provided experience, and driven performances, all while covering more ground than any other player in the league ‚Äì despite the fact that his legs are apparently gone!

Naturally, the well-deserved plaudits he has received have kept the focus on the Swiss international as Sunderland have defied the expectations of a modern newly promoted Premier League side.

But the summer recruitment drive has provided a plethora of players who have all contributed massively to the results that have been achieved thus far. Robin Roefs, Nordi Mukiele, Omar Alderete, Noah Sadiki, Chemsdine Talbi, and Brian Brobbey have all played significant roles in the performances to date but, for me, there is one player who stands out as ‚Äúthe second-best signing of the season‚Äù.

As much as much of the fanbase are still marvelling at the fact that KLD managed to convince Granit Xhaka to join a newly promoted side, I am still astonished that Reinildo Mandava is wearing the red and white of Sunderland after more than three distinguished years wearing the red and white of Atl√©tico Madrid under the demanding Diego Simeone.

His pedigree as a Champions League regular has been obvious, and he has brought much-needed experience to a position which had the potential to be a problem for R√©gis Le Bris. Dennis Cirkin clearly has the ability to make the grade at this level, as does Aji Alese, but both have injury records that are concerning.

Instead, we have been treated to the sight of Reinildo demonstrating his electrifying pace, whether shutting down his side of the defence or rampaging down the wing in support of the likes of Le F√©e and Talbi. Yes, he blotted his copybook with a foolish reaction to being fouled by Aston Villa‚Äôs Matty Cash, but he has come back impeccably. On Sunday, Anthony Elanga might as well have gone to the pub and played the one-armed bandit ‚Äì he would have got more change out of that than he did out of Reinildo!

Reinildo‚Äôs partnership with Omar Alderete has secured the left-hand side of Sunderland‚Äôs defence and given the Paraguayan confidence to step forward when the opportunity arises and display his willingness to both carry the ball forward and to showcase his impressive passing technique. Reinildo provides overlaps and underlaps that create space for Chemsdine Talbi to exploit. On Sunday it was noticeable that Sadiki was pushing forward, finding more advanced positions on the left wing, carrying the ball, and getting to the byline.

And, just as Xhaka has, the Mozambique international has bought into the infectious enthusiasm that exists in Sunderland v.2025 ‚Äì he channelled his inner Muhammad Ali as he bobbed and weaved with the Sky camera on the pitch after the final whistle.

Noah Sadiki will be a bigger miss during AFCON ‚Äì but only because there is no obvious replacement in the squad for the energy and work-rate that he offers. There are more defensive options to cover Reinildo‚Äôs absence, but none of them will bring to the table the complete suite of left-back skills that he has.

When I was writing this, it was a toss-up between Reinildo and Mukiele. The deciding factor for me was the influence that Reinildo has on the performances of other players ‚Äì his presence and athleticism gives Alderete, Talbi, Sadiki, and Le F√©e licence to forage forward and showcase their talents, secure in the knowledge that Reinildo has the pace to cover any counter-attack down that flank.

Granit Xhaka is undoubtedly the signing of the season. For me, Reinildo sits comfortably in second place behind him.

title: The step a Manchester City youngster should have taken may occur in January
description: It seems certain that Claudio Echeverri will return to Manchester City in January. His loan move to Bayer Leverkusen hasn‚Äôt panned out as Echeverri has only made eleven appearances for Leverkusen th...
fullText:
It seems certain that Claudio Echeverri will return to Manchester City in January. His loan move to Bayer Leverkusen hasn‚Äôt panned out as Echeverri has only made eleven appearances for Leverkusen this season. The majority of those appearances have been as a late substitute. Such appearances have done nothing to aid the development of the young attacking midfielder. It has now been reported that Echeverri is open to terminating his loan with Bayer Leverkusen with the hope of joining Vitor Reis at Girona for the second half of this season. That was the move Echeverri should have made at the beginning of this season to aid his development.

Journalist Nil Sola has reported via X that Claudio Echeverri has already said yes to having his loan spell at Bayer Leverkusen terminated in January. Furthermore, Solar reports that Girona are eager to sign Echeverri on loan for the second half of this season. It is also reported by Sola that Claudio Echeverri‚Äôs agent pushed for the young attacking midfielder to join Bayer Leverkusen over Girona last summer. Clearly, that move hasn‚Äôt panned out for Echeverri based on his lack of minutes and first-team opportunities at the Bundesliga club.

Looking back, Claudio Echeverri should have joined Girona for the 25/26 season. He would have had opportunities to play in La Liga at Girona. Vitor Reis has come on in leaps and bounds this season playing regularly in La Liga. Yes, Girona has struggled this season. But Vitor Reis has risen to become one of the best young centre-backs in La Liga. If Echeverri followed a similar path to Reis, he could‚Äôve played a prominent role for Girona. Instead, Echeverri‚Äôs agent pushed him to join Bayer Leverkusen. The idea was sound. Playing regularly in the Bundesliga and the Champions League would have benefited Echeverri. But that hasn‚Äôt occurred. Echeverri has spent the majority of his time on the bench at Leverkusen. That hasn‚Äôt aided his development at all. The first half of the 25/26 season seems to have been a waste for Echeverri.

If Echeverri does join Girona for the second half of the season the hope is that he can turn his season around. He should get first-team opportunities at Girona. It will be up to Echeverri to take them. Girona is a club that will play him and if all goes well, Echeverri could help them in their battle to avoid relegation this season. That would benefit Echeverri‚Äôs development greatly and that is exactly what Manchester City will be hoping for.

Unfortunately, the first half of this season has been a harsh lesson for Claudio Echeverri. He hasn‚Äôt played for Bayer Leverkusen and his loan move to the Bundesliga side has cost him in terms of playing regularly to aid his development. A loan move to Girona could beckon and that is the move Echeverri should have made at the beginning of this season.

title: 3 Stars: Rantanen to Johnston, an adventurous goalie, & wacky but effective PK tactics in win at Sharks
description: The Dallas Stars never trailed and found some wacky ways in a 5-3 win against the San Jose Sharks at SAP Center on Thursday. Rantanen to Johnston is unstoppable Wyatt...
fullText:
The Dallas Stars never trailed and found some wacky ways in a 5-3 win against the San Jose Sharks at SAP Center on Thursday.

Wyatt Johnston and Mikko Rantanen have found some chemistry on the top line this season. Despite not having a consistent linemate on their left, the duo sits first and third in team scoring. Put them on the power play together, and look out, other 31 teams.

Entering tonight, Johnston led the NHL with 12 power-play goals. Despite not scoring them quite as rapidly as he was early on, he was still three goals ahead of No. 2 on that list, Alex DeBrincat. Rantanen ranked third behind only Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl in power-play points.

Well, add another goal for Johnston and another point for Rantanen with the extra man tonight. And was it ever pretty?

Tee'd up beautifully üî• pic.twitter.com/VpYaOg2b4a

‚Äî Dallas Stars (@DallasStars) December 19, 2025

The Stars power play remains near or at the top of the league, and they are scoring goals that often look like this. Knowing where each other are on the ice, making clean passes without hesitation or stickhandling, and finishing off their chances. Elite.

Oh, and I almost forgot to mention that Johnston had already scored in the game. And it was a 5-on-5 goal, which he has not done a lot of lately. According to our pal Craig Ludwig, Johnston needs to show he can produce consistently at even strength if he has any shot of making Team Canada at the Olympics.

Does this look like a player who can do that?

Who says Wyatt can't score 5v5? pic.twitter.com/77t9PynPi5

‚Äî DLLS Stars (@DLLS_Stars) December 19, 2025

The fake hip opener like he is backing down a smaller man in the paint to get the bucket‚Ä¶ So nice. He sells former Stars defenseman John Klingberg on the roll move to his backside, quickly pushes off his right skate, and creates just enough space to wire this wrist shot over the glove. Nice.

Rantanen has two assists so far, primary assists, of course, and has jumped Olli Jokinen for the fifth-most points by a Finnish player in NHL history (751).

On the DLLS pregame show, we talked about how fun and adventurous Alex Nedeljkovic is with the puck. Sean Shapiro watched him a lot in Detroit and made it clear that he has elite puck skills, but will also make questionable decisions or passes every once in a while.

Through 30 minutes, Nedeljkovic had already diced up the Stars forecheck on multiple occasions, but also turned it over twice in his own end. High-event goaltending, and we are just talking about what he can do with the puck.

San Jose couldn‚Äôt create off his passes, and Dallas didn‚Äôt make him pay for his mistakes. But that changed in the final minute of the period when Nedeljkovic decided that Justin Hryckowian could really use a goal after not scoring for nearly a month.

Put it on the Ritz! pic.twitter.com/wygAGplA2J

‚Äî DLLS Stars (@DLLS_Stars) December 19, 2025

While this play was funny and the Stars will happily take the two-goal lead into the third period, I really want to talk more about how much I love Hryckowian‚Äôs game.

He is just always going. He‚Äôs hard on the forecheck. He battles on the walls and in the corners. He works hard to gain positioning in front on both ends of the ice. He has skill to create when he has the puck and hockey IQ to find open space when he doesn‚Äôt. And best of all, he is an absolute pest who often gets under the skin of opponents and finds himself in the majority of post-whistle shenanigans. He makes people mad, and that is a skill in hockey. Trust me, I found a way to do it for years despite being small.

He can also fight, and has joined the ranks along with Jamie Benn, Lian Bichsel, and Mikko Rantanen for Stars skaters who will stand up for their teammates when needed.

Tonight, he showed a lot of that skill and grit, annoying Sharks and tallying his fourth goal of the season to wrap it all up.

The Sharks made this one interesting with Collin Graf‚Äôs third goal in two games against Dallas. I heard those ECAC kids are underrated, eh?

But when the Sharks made their third-period push, it was the Dallas penalty kill that had to once again come up big, as it has done since the first month of the season wrapped up. And they did exactly that.

The Stars PK simply does whatever it needs to do to kill a penalty. That means big saves from Jake Oettinger (or Casey DeSmith), which he does often. It means blocked shots. How about Oskar B√§ck late in the final San Jose power play‚Ä¶ Blocks it, one hand slaps it around the defender and goes off for a change.

And sometimes, it means improvisation to keep the puck out of your net. We‚Äôve seen diving saves, great sticks by Miro Heiskanen or Thomas Harley to keep the puck from crossing the line behind their goalie, and full-on saves from skaters when things get really wacky.

But, wacky times included, I don‚Äôt know if we‚Äôve seen what Colin Blackwell did to get out of a tough position and kill a chunk of time late in the power play‚Ä¶

*Colin Blackwell Heroic Moment Alert* pic.twitter.com/xLgtuI5XBN

‚Äî Robert Tiffin (@RobertTiffin) December 19, 2025

This is incredible. Not only to block the shot and win a race to the puck after your stick goes flying into the neutral zone‚Ä¶ But to stay poised enough to bend down and basically dribble the puck with his gloves‚Ä¶ Remember, he is a great basketball player, folks.

Blackwell turns his right hand over, pokes the puck to his right, then turns and chases it down before pushing it forward with his right glove again. Then, while fighting off a forechecker, he shields the puck, dives forward, and uses his left glove to slap it down the ice and get off for a change.

Dallas went 3-for-3 on the kill.

Sometimes, you just have to do what it takes. The weird Hryckowian goal, the killed power plays, and this Blackwell‚Ä¶ Whatever it was, are good examples of that.

Jamie Benn added the empty-netter to put away another win for Dallas. A win, by the way, for Oettinger on his 27th birthday.

Ilya Lyubushkin looked very solid defensively tonight.

Nils Lundkvist made a few key plays, one being the backcheck and analysis of the rush late in the game on a 2-on-1.

Macklin Celebrini is very good. Sometimes, he seems to be moving too fast either for his own good or for any of his teammates to keep up. He was constantly firing passes that Sharks could not handle or return. But watching him pick up pucks out of his skates and turn and burn with his head WAAAY up is a lot of fun.

Casey DeSmith is expected to start Friday in Anaheim. DeSmith is riding an 11-game personal point streak (8-0-3).

Sharks fans doing the shark chomp and the arena playing ‚ÄúJaws‚Äù music before power plays is pretty cool. Not quite as cool as the ‚Äúfang fingers‚Äù in Nashville, though (100 percent sarcasm, that is so dumb.)

DLLS After Dark brings out the worst (best) in all of us. Don‚Äôt forget to join the postgame show.

title: Seahawks rally and defeat Rams 38-37 in overtime on Thursday Night!
description: The Seattle Seahawks just won the game of the year!
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks have literally never played in a normal game ever, and Thursday Night Football was no exception. What advertised as the showdown of the season more than lived up to its top billing, as the Seahawks defeated the Los Angeles Rams 38-37 in overtime! Seattle rallied from a 30-14 deficit in the fourth quarter to prevail in one of the most thrilling games in franchise history.

The Seahawks now officially control their own destiny, not just for the NFC West, but to earn the No. 1 seed in the NFC playoffs. Imagine, the road to the Super Bowl could very well travel through the Emerald City for the fourth time ever.

As folks often say, "it's not how you start, but how you finish." Well that summed up the Seahawks' night on Thursday, as the beginning hardly looked like this was going to result in a thrilling Seattle win. The Seahawks did open the game with a five-play, 61-yard touchdown drive - their first touchdown scored in the first quarter since the Week 10 win versus the Cardinals. This drive came after Seattle's defense forced a turnover on downs against the Rams' offense. An offense that had scored 41+ points in each of the last two games, mind you.

Los Angeles did not stay silent for long, as they kicked field goals on their next consecutive drive. The Rams eventually took a 13-7 lead in the second quarter, which translated into halftime. Seattle's offense was finding it nearly impossible to stay on the field, as they were getting dominated in time of possession, losing that battle 21:13 to 8:47 after two quarters.

The Seahawks did win the coin toss at the start of the game and got the ball to begin the third quarter. Seattle took full advantage of this opportunity, which saw Kenneth Walker III erupt for a 55-yard touchdown to give the Hawks a 14-13 lead. That was the end of the good vibes in the third quarter for Seattle, as the Rams took full control of the game. Los Angeles retook the lead immediately with a field goal, and intercepted Sam Darnold on the ensuing Seahawks drive. The interception brough the ball to the 1-yard line, where LA scored immediately afterwards to go up 23-14.

Seattle failed to respond, punted the ball, and the Rams delivered what many considered would be the dagger. Stafford drove his team 85 yards in nine plays and found embattled receiver Puka Nacua for a touchdown to build the lead to 30-14. At this point, it felt as if history was repeating itself, especially since recent TNF games at Seattle have resulted in blowout Seahawk losses.

But a spark was found... Los Angeles got the ball thanks to Darnold's second interception of the game deep in their own territory. Seattle's defense did force a punt from the Rams early in the fourth quarter, and wide receiver Rashid Shaheed turned the game around with a 58-yard punt return touchdown. After a successful 2-point conversion, it was suddenly a one-score 30-22 game with plenty of time left.

Rashid Shaheed got the Seahawks back into the game pic.twitter.com/6jjvjQ9UpS

‚Äî The Seahawks Wire (@TheSeahawksWire) December 19, 2025

Following the Rams' third-consecutive punt of the fourth quarter, the Seahawks only needed two plays to find the end zone once more. Rashid Shaheed's big game continued with a 31-yard rush. On the next play, Darnold found tight end AJ Barner for a wide open 26-yard touchdown reception. Suddenly, it was a 30-28 contest.

This is where things got bizarre. The Seahawks attempted a 2-point conversion. Darnold attempted a pass to Zach Charbonnet on a screen pass, but it was deflected and the attempt failed... or so we thought! Upon further review, Darnold had actually thrown the pass backwards, as in, a lateral. This meant Darnold's "incompletion" was actually a fumble, which was recovered in the end zone by a Seahawk who had touched it last. Instead of a Rams lead, the game was shockingly a 30-30 tie!

The north end zone at Lumen Field has bizarre and unexplainable properties. The site of the Fail Mary, Kam Chancellor‚Äôs fumble of Megatron, and now this. #Seahawks pic.twitter.com/IQdGpyZp8R

‚Äî Kole Musgrove (@KoleMusgrove23) December 19, 2025

Los Angeles unfortunately woke back up, and got the ball moving. Stafford maneuvered his offense within field goal range just before the two-minute warning. A quick side bar... in the press box, I was sitting next to Mazvita Maraire of Cascadiasports.net, and he quickly mentioned "well, with the way this game is going, they'll probably miss the field goal."

I should have asked him for lotto numbers next, as the Rams did miss a 48-yarder wide right.

Seattle failed on not one, but two attempts to march down the field for a game-winner of their own. Now, it was overtime. The Seahawks did win the coin toss again, and decided to give the Rams the ball to start. In this new overtime system, both teams will get a chance to possess the ball regardless if the first team scores a touchdown to begin. Seattle wisely chose to go on offense second, as it meant they would be armed with all the knowledge of what they would need to do.

Turns out they would need a touchdown of their own, as Stafford found Nacua for a 41-yard touchdown to go up 37-30. Nacua absolutely torched the Seattle secondary, hauling in 12 receptions for 225 yards and two scores.

This was it... do or die.... the Seahawks had one shot at redemption. One shot to earn revenge, punch their ticket for the postseason, and control their own destiny.

Darnold, who had been battling both the Rams and the national narrative that he cannot show up in big games, was sublime when his team needed him most... once again. Darnold completed five passes for 53 yards, including a gorgeous strike to the former Ram himself, Cooper Kupp. Part one of redemption was found as Darnold found Jaxon Smith-Njigba for the touchdown.

Decision time: do the Seahawks kick a field goal and play for a tie? After all, a tie would have been enough to clinch a playoff spot. Or do they go for the win? Well, fortune favored the bold! Darnold found tight end Eric Saubert for the biggest two-point conversion play of their careers as the Seahawks completed the comeback for a 38-37 victory!

The Seahawks are now 12-3, their first 12-win season since 2020 and only the fourth 12-win season in franchise history. Seattle controls their own destiny. If they win out, they will ensure the road to Super Bowl LX will travel down the Yellow Brick Road to the Emerald City. However, it is no small task. The Seahawks will now travel to Carolina to take on a shockingly competitive Panthers team. Keep in mind, the Panthers did upset the Rams not too long ago.

A special season in Seattle continues next Sunday at 10:00 am Pacific Time.

This article originally appeared on Seahawks Wire: Seahawks vs Rams: Seattle engineers comeback to defeat LA in overtime

title: Puka Nacua deleted tweet: Rams WR criticizes refs on social media after loss to Seahawks
description: The Rams wide receiver once again got in trouble for off-the-field actions.
fullText:
Puka Nacua deleted tweet: Rams WR criticizes refs on social media after loss to Seahawks originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Puka Nacua's wild week came to a head on Thursday night.

Earlier this week, Nacua got into hot water for appearing on Adin Ross' live stream, in which he made an antisemitic gesture and criticized the referees.

"The refs are the worst," Nacua said. "These guys are lawyers. They want to be on TV, too. . . . You don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs texting his friends in the group chat like, 'Yo, you guys just saw me on "Sunday Night Football." Like, 'That wasn't P.I., like, but I called it.' . . . I mean, these guys are normal human beings, too."

Then, on Thursday night, Nacua produced a¬†career-best night as the Los Angeles Rams blew a 16-point lead to the Seattle Seahawks. The game, though, featured a controversial call by the referees that helped the Seahwaks tie the game.

After the game, Nacua appeared to criticize the refs once again, which will put him once again in the league's crosshairs. Here's a breakdown of what Nacua did.

MORE: How Sam Darnold led 16-point comeback

After the Rams' loss to the Seahawks on Thursday night, Nacua instantly fired off a message on social media criticizing the referees.

"Can't say I was wrong," he said. "Appreciate you stripes for your contributions. Lol."

Nacua referenced his comments on Adin Ross' stream earlier this week, when he said "the refs are the worst." The wide receiver immediately deleted the message, but not before it went viral.

The tweet has since been deleted. https://t.co/52fSXsE8WSpic.twitter.com/8HH7TZoio6

‚Äî Sarah Barshop (@sarahbarshop) December 19, 2025

MORE:¬†Updated NFC West standings after Seahawks beat Rams in OT

McVay got to the podium for his postgame press conference after Nacua sent and deleted his tweet, but the Rams head coach wasn't aware of Nacua's actions.

"I can't answer questions about something that I'm not aware of," he said.

On Nacua's controversial appearance on Adin Ross' live stream, McVay had a much more thorough answer and stood by his wide receiver while also acknowledging the wrong Nacua did.

"I don't think he understood the totality of some of the things," "That's a great kid that's continuing to learn about the platform that he has. I love him, we're going to continue put our arm around him and help him learn and grow, but we never want to do things that offend anybody."

Sean McVay learned about Puka Nacua‚Äôs tweet during his postgame press conference and also responded to Nacua‚Äôs livestream with Adin Ross pic.twitter.com/6c9pS4ouNI

‚Äî Ahmed/The Ears/IG: BigBizTheGod üá∏üá¥ (@big_business_) December 19, 2025

McVay denied knowing anything about Nacua trying to get Ross to film on the Rams' facility, but he maintained that he will try to help the wide receiver mature as a person.

title: Toyota Industries Buyout Bid Dips 16% Below Stock Holdings
description: Toyota group‚Äôs proposed ¬•4.7 trillion ($30 billion) offer to privatize a forklift maker has prompted one of the world‚Äôs most tenacious activist funds to call it a lowball offer. A closer look at the target‚Äôs shareholdings helps explain why.
fullText: MarketsBy Nicholas TakahashiSaveToyota group‚Äôs proposed ¬•4.7 trillion ($30 billion) offer to privatize a forklift maker has prompted one of the world‚Äôs most tenacious activist funds to call it a lowball offer. A closer look at the target‚Äôs shareholdings helps explain why. The buyout target, Toyota Industries Corp., owns shares valued at ¬•5.6 trillion, just shy of the company‚Äôs own market value, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. That makes the June buyout offer nearly ¬•1 trillion, or 16%, below the value of those shareholdings.

title: Takeda Rises After AI-Developed Psoriasis Pill Trial Success
description: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. rose the most in seven months on Friday after the drugmaker said its oral psoriasis drug zasocitinib proved safe and effective in late-stage trials, marking a milestone in its effort to treat the incurable skin condition.
fullText: MarketsBy Kanoko MatsuyamaSaveTakeda Pharmaceutical Co. rose the most in seven months on Friday after the drugmaker said its oral psoriasis drug zasocitinib proved safe and effective in late-stage trials, marking a milestone in its effort to treat the incurable skin condition.The stock rose as much as 4.3% in early Tokyo trading, the biggest intraday gain since May 13.

title: ANZ Fine Raised to $165 Million by Court After Bank‚Äôs Misconduct
description: ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.‚Äôs fine was increased to A$250 million ($165 million) by the Federal Court of Australia after an additional A$10 million was added to earlier regulatory penalties.
fullText: MarketsBy Adam HaighSaveANZ Group Holdings Ltd.‚Äôs fine was increased to A$250 million ($165 million) by the Federal Court of Australia after an additional A$10 million was added to earlier regulatory penalties. The Melbourne-based bank was fined in September after admitting misconduct across its institutional and retail divisions that included misreporting bond data and charging fees to customers who had died. ANZ had originally agreed with the Australian Securities and Investments Commission to a A$240 million penalty after a months-long investigation by the corporate watchdog.

title: Stock Pickers Regain Favor at Australian Pension on Index Risks
description: Australian Retirement Trust, the nation‚Äôs no. 2 pension fund, is switching more money from passive index funds to active equity managers, citing the growing dominance of major technology companies in global benchmarks.
fullText: MarketsBy Richard Henderson and Amy BainbridgeSaveAustralian Retirement Trust, the nation‚Äôs no. 2 pension fund, is switching more money from passive index funds to active equity managers, citing the growing dominance of major technology companies in global benchmarks.The A$330 billion ($218 billion) fund plans to gradually wind back its roughly 70% weighting in passive funds and return closer to the even split it‚Äôs traditionally targeted, according to Andrew Fisher, head of investment strategy for ART. He expects active managers to respond more nimbly ‚Äî identifying winners and avoiding losers ‚Äî if the current concentration in US tech eases.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC Trading Debut to Set Tone for Other Fund Houses Preparing for IPOs

fullText: MarketsBy Ashutosh JoshiSaveBefore the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:Happy Friday readers. title: Senate Confirms Selig as Chief of CFTC and Hill to Run the FDIC
description: The US Senate on Thursday night confirmed Michael Selig as chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission and Travis Hill as chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., installing permanent chiefs of two agencies that play critical roles overseeing financial markets and banks.
fullText: MarketsBy Lydia BeyoudSaveThe US Senate on Thursday night confirmed Michael Selig as chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission and Travis Hill as chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., installing permanent chiefs of two agencies that play critical roles overseeing financial markets and banks. The CFTC traditionally regulates the swaps and derivatives markets but is on the precipice of change as lawmakers consider legislation that would grant the agency greater authority over digital assets.

title: Pendal's Patrick on Fed's Rate Path Options
description: Pendal Group Head of Income Strategies Amy Xie Patrick speaks about how potential Fed rate cut projections are impacted by inflation numbers as well as market expectations towards President Trump's economic policies.

title: Catastrophe Bonds Linked to Wildfires Lose ‚ÄòUntouchable‚Äô Status
description: Alternative investment managers are starting to take a serious interest in catastrophe bonds tied to wildfires, moving into a risk category that just a few years ago was seen as too difficult to model.
fullText: MarketsBy Gautam NaikSaveAlternative investment managers are starting to take a serious interest in catastrophe bonds tied to wildfires, moving into a risk category that just a few years ago was seen as too difficult to model.More than $5 billion of cat bonds with some level of exposure to wildfire risk were issued by insurers and sold to investors this year, according to Artemis, a specialist in insurance-linked securities that tracks market trends. That‚Äôs more than twice the level in 2024, with previous years seeing just a smattering of individual bond sales in the tens of millions of dollars.

title: Nickel Extends Rebound After Indonesia Signals Mine Output Cut
description: Nickel advanced for a third day, extending its rebound from an eight-month low on the prospect of reduced supply from top producer Indonesia.
fullText: MarketsCommoditiesBy Bloomberg NewsSaveNickel advanced for a third day, extending its rebound from an eight-month low on the prospect of reduced supply from top producer Indonesia.The metal rose as much as 1.5% on Friday, two days after Indonesia proposed cutting nickel ore production in 2026. The government‚Äôs work plan budget for next year envisages output of about 250 million tons, down from this year‚Äôs goal of 379 million tons.

title: Chinese Coking Coal Heads for Biggest Weekly Gain Since August
description: Chinese coking coal futures headed for their biggest weekly gain since August, in a sentiment-driven rally that also helped lift iron ore and steel prices.
fullText: MarketsBy Katharine GemmellSaveChinese coking coal futures headed for their biggest weekly gain since August, in a sentiment-driven rally that also helped lift iron ore and steel prices.The steelmaking fuel dipped on Friday, but was still up more than 8% for the week. The futures traded in Dalian surged by 6% on Thursday.

title: Yen Weakens as BOJ Lacks Clarity on Future Hikes: Analysts
description: The yen weakened against the dollar after the Bank of Japan offered no clear guidance on the timing of future monetary tightening, analysts said. While the central bank raised its benchmark interest rate to its highest level since 1995 as expected, investors will now turn to Governor Kazuo Ueda‚Äôs press conference later Friday for any further outlook.
fullText: MarketsBy Mia Glass, John Cheng, and Hidenori YamanakaSaveThe yen weakened against the dollar after the Bank of Japan offered no clear guidance on the timing of future monetary tightening, analysts said. While the central bank raised its benchmark interest rate to its highest level since 1995 as expected, investors will now turn to Governor Kazuo Ueda‚Äôs press conference later Friday for any further outlook.Here‚Äôs what strategists had to say:

title: Japan‚Äôs 10-Year Bond Yield Hits 2% for First Time Since 2006
description: Japan‚Äôs 10-year government bond yield hit the 2% milestone for the first time since 2006 after the Bank of Japan raised its benchmark interest rate to the highest in 30 years.
fullText: MarketsBondsBy John Cheng and Mia GlassSaveJapan‚Äôs 10-year government bond yield hit the 2% milestone for the first time since 2006 after the Bank of Japan raised its benchmark interest rate to the highest in 30 years. The bond yield rose 3.5 basis points at 12:56 p.m. in Tokyo, as yields on other tenors climbed. Japan‚Äôs yields have recently risen to multi-year highs across the curve, on renewed fiscal concerns as well as rising expectations of rate hikes.

title: China A500 ETFs Inflows Surge to Record High Toward Year End
description: Inflows to a group of exchange-traded funds tracking the CSI A500 Index surged to a fresh record on Thursday, with the strong activity leaving traders perplexed.
fullText: MarketsBy Bloomberg NewsSaveInflows to a group of exchange-traded funds tracking the CSI A500 Index surged to a fresh record on Thursday, with the strong activity leaving traders perplexed.Investors bought 8.7 billion yuan ($1.2 billion) worth of shares in seven of the largest CSI A500 ETFs, including that from Huatai-Pinebridge Fund Management Co., a day after a record turnover in the cohort. That compares with an inflow of just 220 million yuan into a group of eight funds known to be preferred by the national team.

title: Toyota to Sell Made-in-America Cars in Japan to Please Trump
description: Toyota Motor Corp. is going to ship three models produced in America to Japan next year, the Japanese auto giant‚Äôs latest gesture designed to indulge US President Donald Trump.
fullText: IndustriesTransportationBy Nicholas TakahashiSaveToyota Motor Corp. is going to ship three models produced in America to Japan next year, the Japanese auto giant‚Äôs latest gesture designed to indulge US President Donald Trump.The Camry sedan, Highlander sport utility vehicle and Tundra pickup truck will go on sale in Japan from 2026, Toyota said Friday in a statement. The vehicles are produced in Kentucky, Indiana and Texas, respectively.

title: Bank of Japan Hikes Benchmark Rate to Highest Level Since 1995
description: The Bank of Japan raised its benchmark interest rate to the highest in 30 years and said more increases are in the pipeline if conditions allow, in a sign of growing conviction that it can attain the stable inflation target it has pursued for more than a decade.
fullText: EconomicsCentral BanksBy Toru FujiokaSaveThe Bank of Japan raised its benchmark interest rate to the highest in 30 years and said more increases are in the pipeline if conditions allow, in a sign of growing conviction that it can attain the stable inflation target it has pursued for more than a decade.Governor Kazuo Ueda‚Äôs policy board increased the rate by a quarter percentage point to 0.75%, in a unanimous decision, according to its statement Friday. The central bank cited the rising likelihood of its economic outlook being realized. The rate change was expected by all 50 economists surveyed by Bloomberg.

description: ICICI Prudential Asset Management Co. surged in its Mumbai trading debut on Friday after an initial public offering that raised 106 billion rupees ($1.2 billion), potentially marking the year‚Äôs final major listing.

title: Gold, Silver Near Record Highs as US Data Support Rate-Cut Bets
description: Gold and silver hovered near record highs, after slower-than-expected inflation in the US supported bets for more interest-rate cuts. Platinum was close to a 17-year peak.
fullText: MarketsBy Robin Paxton and Preeti SoniSaveGold and silver hovered near record highs, after slower-than-expected inflation in the US supported bets for more interest-rate cuts. Platinum was close to a 17-year peak.Spot gold was near $4,320 an ounce in Asia hours on Friday, and on track for a second weekly gain. The core US consumer price index rose at the slowest pace since early 2021, according to data released on Thursday, bolstering the case for lower borrowing costs ‚Äì a tailwind for non-yielding precious metals.

title: China‚Äôs Economic Shift: Why the Old Playbook No Longer Works
description: McKinsey Greater China Chairman Joe Ngai discusses why China's era of easy growth is over and what companies must do to survive a more challenging environment, where businesses are "fighting for their life." Ngai is co-author of the upcoming book "The Next China Is Still China: An Insider's Playbook for Winning in the New Era."

title: Oil Heads for Second Weekly Decline as Glut Concerns Dominate
description: Oil headed for a second weekly decline as concerns over a growing glut outweighed potential supply disruptions.
fullText: MarketsBy Bloomberg NewsSaveOil headed for a second weekly decline as concerns over a growing glut outweighed potential supply disruptions. Brent was below $60 a barrel and was down more than 2% for the week while West Texas Intermediate traded near $56 a barrel. Virtually all of the world‚Äôs biggest traders see the market in a state of oversupply early next year, with industry heavyweight Trafigura forecasting the Brent benchmark will be in the $50s through the middle of 2026.

title: Japan‚Äôs 10-Year Yield Tops 2%, Yen Holds Losses After BOJ Hike
description: Japan‚Äôs 10-year government bond yield rose to a multi-decade high as investors reacted to the central bank‚Äôs interest rate hike, while the yen weakened in choppy trading. Japanese stocks held gains.
fullText: MarketsCurrenciesBy John ChengSaveJapan‚Äôs 10-year government bond yield rose to a multi-decade high as investors reacted to the central bank‚Äôs interest rate hike, while the yen weakened in choppy trading. Japanese stocks held gains.While Friday‚Äôs Bank of Japan decision was unanimously expected by economists, traders focused on the lack of clear guidance on the timing of future monetary tightening.

title: Vestas Soars 74% in 2025 on Order Growth, Easing Policy Fears
description: Things weren‚Äôt looking good for Vestas Wind Systems A/S in January, with the return of Donald Trump and his anti-renewables policies after an already difficult stretch for the turbine maker.
fullText: MarketsBy Sara Sjolin and Marton KasnyikSaveThings weren‚Äôt looking good for Vestas Wind Systems A/S in January, with the return of Donald Trump and his anti-renewables policies after an already difficult stretch for the turbine maker.Now, the Danish company is ending 2025 among Europe‚Äôs biggest winners, with a 74% share-price gain marking a big rebound from a slump the prior year. It‚Äôs also the top performer in the OMX Copenhagen 25 Index, helping offset a plunge for Ozempic maker Novo Nordisk A/S.

title: The War Photographer Who Can‚Äôt Walk Away
description: Lynsey Addario is a Pulitzer Prize winning war photographer who has been abducted twice while documenting conflict from Afghanistan to Sudan. She tells The Mishal Husain Show why her job is to "bear witness." This interview contains descriptions of abduction, violence and sexual assault which some viewers may find distressing.

title: Chinese Self-Driving Tech Firm CiDi Lists in HK
description: CiDi, a provider of autonomous driving technology for commercial vehicles, has listed its shares in Hong Kong. Its CEO Albert Sibo Hu discusses the company's growth and international expansion strategy. He speaks with Yvonne Man on "Bloomberg: The China Show."

title: Asian Shares Gain After US CPI, Japan Yields Climb: Markets Wrap
description: Asian stocks followed gains in US equities as cooling inflation backed the case for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts. Japanese 10-year bond yields climbed to multi-decade highs after the Bank of Japan raised rates as expected.
fullText: MarketsBy Richard Henderson and Abhishek VishnoiSaveAsian stocks followed gains in US equities as cooling inflation backed the case for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts. Japanese 10-year bond yields climbed to multi-decade highs after the Bank of Japan raised rates as expected.The MSCI Asia Pacific Index advanced 0.7%, with tech giants such as SoftBank Group Corp. and Tencent Holdings Ltd. among the biggest contributors. The S&P 500 climbed 0.8% Thursday, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 rallied 1.5%. Gains were helped by a solid outlook from giant Micron Technology Inc., easing concerns over artificial intelligence spending and valuations. US equity futures were little changed Friday, while European contracts fell.

title: Sunway Healthcare Said to Gauge Interest for Malaysia IPO in January
description: Malaysia‚Äôs Sunway Healthcare Holdings Bhd. will start gauging investor interest as soon as January for an initial public offering that may raise around $700 million, according to people familiar with the matter.
fullText: MarketsBy Dave SebastianSaveMalaysia‚Äôs Sunway Healthcare Holdings Bhd. will start gauging investor interest as soon as January for an initial public offering that may raise around $700 million, according to people familiar with the matter. The health-care arm of conglomerate Sunway Bhd. plans to list in Kuala Lumpur as early as March, the people said, asking not to be named as the discussions are private. Deliberations are ongoing, and the size and timing of the deal may change, they said.

title: Adani Airport Unit to Invest $11 Billion, Seeks Partner Pre-IPO
description: Billionaire Gautam Adani‚Äôs group plans to invest more than $11 billion in its airports business by 2030, as it seeks to bid for nearly a dozen new terminals, upgrade infrastructure and expand into aircraft maintenance, a top executive said.
fullText: MarketsBy Sanjai P R, Mihir Mishra, and Jeanette RodriguesSaveBillionaire Gautam Adani‚Äôs group plans to invest more than $11 billion in its airports business by 2030, as it seeks to bid for nearly a dozen new terminals, upgrade infrastructure and expand into aircraft maintenance, a top executive said.The unit will spend 1 trillion rupees ($11.1 billion) on terminals, runways and aircraft-handling facilities and passenger amenities, Jeet Adani, director at Adani Airport Holdings Ltd., said in an interview at the group‚Äôs new airport outside Mumbai.
